added_lines: This is the Heat template associated with the OpenStack Workload Reference Architecture for Web Applications, at http://www.openstack.org/software/sample-configs/#web-applications. The Heat template deploys a sample three-tier web application environment: WordPress on LAMP. There are two versions of the template – one creates a static environment which does not require Ceilometer; the other provides auto-scaling of the web and application tiers based on CPU load, and requires Ceilometer. Please refer to the README file in the zip file for more details on using the templates. The templates have been tested on Mitaka release of OpenStack, and Ubuntu Server 14.04 and Centos 7. url: https://a9913b12a4cd2c87c95f-589461742fc8c857ce7a37ebc26061be.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/web-application.zip
deleted_lines: This is the sample heat template for the Web Application reference architecture document produced by the OpenStack Enterprise Working Group. The reference architecture document can be found at https://www.openstack.org/enterprise. This heat template deploys WordPress on a 3-Tier LAMP architecture. There are two versions of the template - one creates a static environment which does not require ceilometer; the other provides autoscaling of the web and application tiers based on CPU load which requires ceilometer. For more details please refer to the README file in the zip file on how to use the template. The templates have been tested on Mitaka release of OpenStack, and Ubuntu Server 14.04 and Centos7. url: https://github.com/yihleong/ewg/blob/master/web-application/archive/web-application.zip

commit_message:
DNM: [placement] Get rid of the xfail on the wide unicode gabbits

This is to see if all our usual services can handle the wide. If
so we'll just go with it and not bother with the xfail safety valve.
That was there because there was some concern that some of the
databases in the gate wouldn't be able to cope, but we didn't want
that to indicate failure.

Change-Id: Iae3b2b0bfce64021de0f10e79a4404f8a2015054

commit_message:
Update upload_cirros to support multiple images

This change creates a puppet parser function to convert the
test_vm_image from hiera into a glance_image compatible array of hashes
that can be used with create_resources. Previously vmware deployments
included an extra TestVM to be uploaded but during the rewrite of the
upload_cirros task this ability was dropped.

Change-Id: I3f0f6da32134a4a15f2c4764c5334bb8e85309c8
Closes-Bug: #1603393

subject: Openstack vanilla networking support with DVR.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-02 11:58:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/salt-formula-neutron/commit/af268f842d43abed21b6f4ad160639218441933c', 'message': 'Openstack vanilla networking support with DVR.

Reintroduced non-contrail option from previous versions (Juno and earlier).

Added DVR option and modified machine roles and their services accordingly.
Also renames switch and router to compute and network to be consistent with node naming in manuals.

commit_message:
Openstack vanilla networking support with DVR.

Reintroduced non-contrail option from previous versions (Juno and earlier).

Added DVR option and modified machine roles and their services accordingly.
Also renames switch and router to compute and network to be consistent with node naming in manuals.

It supports VXLAN and GRE tenant networks and VLAN provider networks for external access.

Uses the MTU option from reclass in dnsmasq config.

Fixes root_helper line in agent config files to actually work.

It has been tested on Kilo with several compute nodes and 3 network nodes collocated with HA controllers. Used Jumbo frames in underlay.

Change-Id: I29ded3487bbeba1947ed858d4b17aa64ba9b8e4b
Closes-Bug: #1559335

deleted_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================= Workflow UUID support in Mistral REST API ========================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/use-workflow-id-in-rest-api Problem description =================== Currently, we identify a workflow by its name, of course, the workflow name is unique within a tenant's scope. However, when we use 'public' workflows or we want to get benifits from workflow sharing feature[1], we may see more than one workflows with the same name (you can see a related bug which has been fixed here[2]). Even worse, users will never see other 'same-name' workflows when performing ``mistral workflow-get <name>`` command, since it always returns the first one. Look at almost all other projects, they always use UUID as globally unique resource identifier, especially in the REST API, the resource name is a string that can be duplicated throughout the whole system, and may be changed frequently as the time goes by. So, I propose we use UUID as the workflow global unique identifier in the REST API. What's more, we can consider using UUID for other resources after that. Use Cases --------- * As a user, I want to see the definition of a public scope workflow, whose name is the same with one of my private workflows or another public workflow. * As a user or application developer, I want to send REST API to Mistral with resource UUID contained, rather than resource name. Proposed change =============== We need to support workflow UUID as a parameter of pecan WorkflowsController related methods(GET, PUT, DELETE), we still support workflow name for backward compatibility, the magic will be happened in the db api layer. At the meanwhile, workflow UUID needs to be exposed to end users, using which users could do operations they want. Things will be a little complicated for PUT method. Before, when we want to update a workflow definition, Mistral only accepts URL like http://localhost:8989/v2/workflows and the new workflow definition content as request body, which means workflow name is an identifier when updating workflow definition, and can't be changed. In order to support UUID, a new parameter with an appropriate default value will be added to PUT method, with the UUID, workflow name can be changed. In addition, when updating a workflow with UUID provided, only one workflow definition could be contained in request body. Since UUID is so important right now, users should see that both via REST API or Mistral client, a good news is, UUID has already be supported from both server side and client side[3]. Changes should also be made for db interface, operations should be supported based on UUID. Alternatives ------------ Without the UUID support in REST API, those problems mentioned in the first section can't be solved totally. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- All the REST API requests for workflow resource will support UUID, the request and response body are the same with before, the only exception to this is PUT HTTP method. When updating a workflow with UUID provided, only one workflow definition could be contained in request body. End user impact --------------- It's strongly recommended that users use UUID in URL of HTTP request or in the command line. Performance Impact ------------------ None Deployer impact --------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: kong <anlin.kong@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- * Add UUID support for GET, PUT, DELETE mothod of workflow REST API. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Test the UUID support in REST API and/or Mistral client side. References ========== [1]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-resource-sharing [2]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-mistralclient/+bug/1518276 [3]: https://review.openstack.org/248031

commit_message:
Fix cluster progress calculation if Astute didn't send it

Deploying status has been removed, we assume that the node is
int deploying status if status is provisioned or ready, and
progress is greater than zero.

Change-Id: Ia64b5c9e54591892685f1e1806124f2523bcb40b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/44/386644/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adds support for disks on HP Smart Array Controllers

This commit adds handling for RAID controllers which use the cciss driver.
Ansible detects devices attached to this driver with the format of
'cciss!c#d#', whereas commands run using the ansible provided name expect the
format of 'cciss/c#d#' or 'cciss/c#d#p#'.

Change-Id: I4062a5df0dd5a05e08aac566d3f564a081bebd01
Closes-Bug: #1634318

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Remove default=None when set value in Config

By default oslo.cfg sets the default values as None [1], There is
no need to explicitly do this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L829

Change-Id: I125accf35e5e012543e72e2dbde35409e1f41247

commit_message:
Sync tools/tox_install.sh

Sync tools/tox_install.sh with python-openstackclient. This brings in
the following improvements:

* Do not leave temporary directory around, instead delete temporary
  directory directly after usage (change
  I939eae82dba3287fd4e4086128ebf4609a0e0770).
* Do not set ZUUL_BRANCH explicitely and remove unused if condition
  (change I0077c986a17d6bb92791474e03d1e77776e9382f).

Change-Id: Iefc76dd2f9171287fc1a12af9b1de58f58ce0c4f
(cherry picked from commit b4b15c94576f319f0fa0a12be679d76bbf952221)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-statsd refs/changes/38/385538/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mydir=$(mktemp -dt "$PACKAGE_NAME-tox_install-XXXXXXX") trap "rm -rf $mydir" EXIT localfile=$mydir/upper-constraints.txt if [[ $CONSTRAINTS_FILE != http* ]]; then CONSTRAINTS_FILE=file://$CONSTRAINTS_FILEcurl $CONSTRAINTS_FILE -k -o $localfile install_cmd="$install_cmd -c$localfile" if [ $requirements_installed -eq 0 ]; then echo "ALREADY INSTALLED" > /tmp/tox_install.txt echo "Requirements already installed; using existing package" elif [ -x "$ZUUL_CLONER" ]; then echo "ZUUL CLONER" > /tmp/tox_install.txt pushd $mydir $ZUUL_CLONER --cache-dir \ /opt/git \ --branch $BRANCH_NAME \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack/requirements cd openstack/requirements $install_cmd -e . popd else echo "PIP HARDCODE" > /tmp/tox_install.txt if [ -z "$REQUIREMENTS_PIP_LOCATION" ]; then REQUIREMENTS_PIP_LOCATION="git+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements@$BRANCH_NAME#egg=requirements" fi $install_cmd -U -e ${REQUIREMENTS_PIP_LOCATION} fi # This is the main purpose of the script: Allow local installation of # the current repo. It is listed in constraints file and thus any # install will be constrained and we need to unconstrain it. edit-constraints $localfile -- $PACKAGE_NAME "-e file://$PWD#egg=$PACKAGE_NAME"
deleted_lines: if [[ $CONSTRAINTS_FILE != "unconstrained" ]]; then mydir=$(mktemp -dt "$PACKAGE_NAME-tox_install-XXXXXXX") localfile=$mydir/upper-constraints.txt if [[ $CONSTRAINTS_FILE != http* ]]; then CONSTRAINTS_FILE=file://$CONSTRAINTS_FILE fi curl $CONSTRAINTS_FILE -k -o $localfile install_cmd="$install_cmd -c$localfile" if [ $requirements_installed -eq 0 ]; then echo "ALREADY INSTALLED" > /tmp/tox_install.txt echo "Requirements already installed; using existing package" elif [ -x "$ZUUL_CLONER" ]; then export ZUUL_BRANCH=${ZUUL_BRANCH-$BRANCH} echo "ZUUL CLONER" > /tmp/tox_install.txt pushd $mydir $ZUUL_CLONER --cache-dir \ /opt/git \ --branch $BRANCH_NAME \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack/requirements cd openstack/requirements $install_cmd -e . popd else echo "PIP HARDCODE" > /tmp/tox_install.txt if [ -z "$REQUIREMENTS_PIP_LOCATION" ]; then REQUIREMENTS_PIP_LOCATION="git+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements@$BRANCH_NAME#egg=requirements" fi $install_cmd -U -e ${REQUIREMENTS_PIP_LOCATION} fi edit-constraints $localfile -- $PACKAGE_NAME "-e file://$PWD#egg=$PACKAGE_NAME"

commit_message:
Fix for Tegile driver failing to establish volume connection

LUN number reported should be integer, but it is returned
as a string by the backend storage. This change would help
handle the case.

Change-Id: I600cb94d646fabbb053f390dd9b3db489ebedfc8
Closes-Bug: #1630035

commit_message:
Not allow overcommit ratios to be negative

Currently the three overcommit ratios: ram_allocation_ratio,
cpu_allocation_ratio, and disk_allocation_ratio can be set to negative values.
It's up to the scheduler filters to impose the checks on these ratios.

It makes more sense to make sure these 3 ratios are not negative when
nova-compute is started.  If any of these ratios is negative then nova-compute
service will fail to start.

Closes-Bug: #1604116
Change-Id: Ic960e319b59910c0178e81259b2e35435f2db592

However %(value)s is provided.") % { 'name': name, 'value': value} raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=reason)

commit_message:
Switching to objectified RPC

This patch makes the objectified RPC the default configuration. The
intent is to reduce code (including test cases) duplication along the
transition.

Change-Id: I4a8eb320f0c4a4911dee45f5596eae55ffd7695a

commit_message:
Fix routing for adding a secret to a container

This CR fixes the bug where sending a POST to add a secret to a
container would fail with 404 - Not Found when the path included a
traling forward slash (/).

The underlying issue was that the remainder tuple returned by the pecan
framework is of different lengths depending on whether the url includes
the trailing slash or not.

Change-Id: I89282ad78ceedf4db795564f59306b9e88cc0612
Closes-Bug: 1627176
(cherry picked from commit 608bfd3b02876826ff58b32e85d421ed916fe401)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 09:02:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/b7a958127c3d98d492f46269ea1d0a639be4deb6', 'message': 'Fix consuming from unbound reply queue

Consumer declaration consist of the next steps:
  1) declare an exchange

  3) bind the queue to the exchange

Due to reply exchanges are auto-delete, at the

So, in this case the queue is exist and AMQPListener
just call consumer.consume() on the queue and go to

commit_message:
Fix consuming from unbound reply queue

Consumer declaration consist of the next steps:
  1) declare an exchange
  2) declare a queue
  3) bind the queue to the exchange

Due to reply exchanges are auto-delete, at the
step 3 the exchange can be removed and consumer.declare()
will raise `queue.bind 404 Exchange not found`.

So, in this case the queue is exist and AMQPListener
just call consumer.consume() on the queue and go to
drain_events() despite on the fact that the queue is
unbound.

This change tries to redeclare queue/exchange proactively
each times channel change and just before consuming messages.

Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1609766
Change-Id: Id8b48df3d26675d72955d417ce7622b1e8aa6195
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/59/365959/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._declared_on = None def maybe_declare(self, conn): if conn.channel == self._declared_on: return self._declared_on = conn.channel def consume(self, conn, tag) # Ensure we are on the correct channel before consuming self.maybe_declare(conn) try: self.queue.consume(callback=self._callback, consumer_tag=six.text_type(tag), nowait=self.nowait) except conn.connection.channel_errors as exc: # We retries once because of some races that we can # recover before informing the deployer # bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1581148 # bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1609766 # bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1318721 if exc.code == 404: self.maybe_declare(conn) self.queue.consume(callback=self._callback, consumer_tag=six.text_type(tag), nowait=self.nowait) else: raise for consumer in self._consumers: consumer.maybe_declare(self) consumer.maybe_declare(self) while self._new_tags consumer.consume(self, tag=tag) self._new_tags.remove(tag)
deleted_lines: def declare(self, conn): def consume(self, tag): self.queue.consume(callback=self._callback, consumer_tag=six.text_type(tag), nowait=self.nowait) for consumer in self._consumers: consumer.declare(self) consumer.declare(self) consume_max_retries = 2 while self._new_tags and consume_max_retries: try: consumer.consume(tag=tag) self._new_tags.remove(tag) except self.connection.channel_errors as exc: # NOTE(kbespalov): during the interval between # a queue declaration and consumer declaration # the queue can disappear. In this case # we must redeclare queue and try to re-consume. # More details is here: # bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1581148 if exc.code == 404 and consume_max_retries: consumer.declare(self) # NOTE(kbespalov): the broker closes a channel # at any channel error. The py-amqp catches # this situation and re-open a new channel. # So, we must re-declare all consumers again. self._new_tags = set(self._consumers.values()) consume_max_retries -= 1 break else: raise

commit_message:
Fix engine and engine test cases

This patch fixes two problems. The first is that profile_id is specified
as None when updating a cluster. The second is about engine test case
which should do assertions according to global config.

Change-Id: I699e184f64347e5663c063fab98679a46df19968

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I008cbed4454d5529373badcd14a16472068c1a7d

commit_message:
WIP: Conditional Fast-POST

When Swift is POST-as-COPY mode, condition checking metadata on POST requests
('if-match', 'if-modified-since', 'if^unmodified-since') are effective.
However, when Swift is Fast-POST mode, they are not effective.
This patch fixes these condition checking metadata effective on POST requests,
in fast-POST mode Swift.
Conditional fast-POST will be used in Automated-Tiering functions.

Change-Id: I607f372b1e865689c8b736660e009cdf78f72b13

commit_message:
devstack: exclude tests that uses ssh

As metadata isn't supported, tests that uses ssh to login fails with
timeout. cirros image uses metadata server to inject ssh key.
For now exclude those tests.

Change-Id: Iaf8e84afc9577aa2a6679828633a68580fb4d6f3
Related-Bug: #1635083

commit_message:
[POC] Use query object instead of using request obj in servers index/detail

Try to use the new object instead of using the original GET params from
request object.

added_lines: from nova.api.openstack.compute.objects import servers as servers_obj @validation.query_params_object(servers_obj.ServerIndexQueryParams) def index(self, req, query_params_obj): servers = self._get_servers(req, False, query_params_obj) @validation.query_params_object(servers_obj.ServerIndexQueryParams) def detail(self, req, query_params_obj): servers = self._get_servers(req, True, query_params_obj) def _get_servers(self, req, is_detail, query_params_obj): search_opts = query_params_obj.to_dict() if 'status' in query_params_obj: states = common.task_and_vm_state_from_status( query_params_obj.status) if query_params_obj.all_tenants: limit, marker = common.get_limit_and_marker_from_query_obj( query_params_obj) sort_keys, sort_dirs = common.get_sort_params_from_query_obj( query_params_obj)
deleted_lines: def index(self, req): servers = self._get_servers(req, is_detail=False) def detail(self, req): servers = self._get_servers(req, is_detail=True) def _get_servers(self, req, is_detail): search_opts = {} search_opts.update(req.GET) if 'status' in req.GET.keys(): statuses = req.GET.getall('status') states = common.task_and_vm_state_from_status(statuses) if 'changes-since' in search_opts: try: parsed = timeutils.parse_isotime(search_opts['changes-since']) except ValueError: msg = _('Invalid changes-since value') raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) search_opts['changes-since'] = parsed # By default, compute's get_all() will return deleted instances. # If an admin hasn't specified a 'deleted' search option, we need # to filter out deleted instances by setting the filter ourselves. # ... Unless 'changes-since' is specified, because 'changes-since' # should return recently deleted instances according to the API spec. if 'deleted' not in search_opts: if 'changes-since' not in search_opts: # No 'changes-since', so we only want non-deleted servers search_opts['deleted'] = False else: # Convert deleted filter value to a valid boolean. # Return non-deleted servers if an invalid value # is passed with deleted filter. search_opts['deleted'] = strutils.bool_from_string( search_opts['deleted'], default=False) # Verify the value of the 'name' option is a correct regex. if 'name' in search_opts: try: re.compile(search_opts['name']) except re.error: msg = _("The regex for server name is incorrect") raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) # If tenant_id is passed as a search parameter this should # imply that all_tenants is also enabled unless explicitly # disabled. Note that the tenant_id parameter is filtered out # by remove_invalid_options above unless the requestor is an # admin. # TODO(gmann): 'all_tenants' flag should not be required while # searching with 'tenant_id'. Ref bug# 1185290 # +microversions to achieve above mentioned behavior by # uncommenting below code. # if 'tenant_id' in search_opts and 'all_tenants' not in search_opts: # We do not need to add the all_tenants flag if the tenant # id associated with the token is the tenant id # specified. This is done so a request that does not need # the all_tenants flag does not fail because of lack of # policy permission for compute:get_all_tenants when it # doesn't actually need it. # if context.project_id != search_opts.get('tenant_id'): # search_opts['all_tenants'] = 1 all_tenants = common.is_all_tenants(search_opts) if all_tenants: limit, marker = common.get_limit_and_marker(req) sort_keys, sort_dirs = common.get_sort_params(req.params)

added_lines: def query_params_object(query_params_cls): def create_obj(func): @functools.wraps(func) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): if 'req' in kwargs: req = kwargs['req'] else: req = args[1] obj = query_params_cls.get_from_req(req) kwargs['query_params_obj'] = obj return func(*args, **kwargs) return wrapper return create_obj

commit_message:
[POC] Add base class for the object of query parameters

This patch adds base class which is used to the object of query
parameters. The base class's classmethod '_from_query_params' implement
the validation of query parameter by JSON-schema. Also mapping the query
parameters into the object.

Change-Id: I230f62f7faf9480bd63594cdd804f06fe5d3ad79

commit_message:
Show deprecation warning and limit features for KSC session

There are still a lot of places where keystoneclient sessions are being
used and we've made a fair effort to maintain compatibility with these
sessions.

Unfortunately passing client_name and client_version for user_agent
generation is something only present in keystoneauth and passing it to a
keystoneclient session results in failure.

Whilst it would be good to just tell people to fix their code in reality
we'll probably be dealing with this for a while so just check to ensure
it really is a keystoneauth session we are passing parameters to and
warn otherwise.

Change-Id: I4d51ee08cfa9094443aca7128fe5323a95974a4d

commit_message:
PCI: Avoid looping over PCI devices twice

The get_instance_pci_devs() methos is called twice when the libvirt
driver is creating the guest config when xen, qemu or kvm hypervisor is
used.

This also makes the code easier to understand.

Change-Id: Id6d5ee1d46ee0d8cab9432f24af3c1493080545a

commit_message:
Allow setting client_name, client_version on adapter

You can pass client_name and client_version to Adapter.__init__ but for
most clients this means overriding Adapter.__init__ and setdefault()-ing
the client_name and version.

As most clients already override the Adapter object it'd be easier if
they could just set these values on the class as they are not going to
change between instances.

Change-Id: I301a7f77c8cf423bc1d45e3dcbb2325f6853b9a9

added_lines: client_name = None client_version = None if client_name: self.client_name = client_name if client_version: self.client_version = client_version

commit_message:
Replace 'MagicMock' with 'Mock'

MagicMock magically allow things to pass. Any usage should
be replaced with the Mock class and explicit attributes
should be set on it. [1]
[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17181687/mock-vs-magicmock

Change-Id: I5f41984f3cc9b6f298218b95c27f6643878d47d3

commit_message:
Add parameters field for protectable instances API

Scenario #1
User need a parameter for the region name to query resource
instances from different region endpoint.

Scenario #2
User uses the Protectable Instances API to query database
instances from the verdor's backup software. User must provide
some parameters about authentication to the restfull API of the
verdor's backup software.

A dict type parameter is needed for Protectable Instances API.
And it is optional.

blueprint instances-parameters

Change-Id: I9b5d2dc581edda23543f4b264c334bc429bcd3c3

commit_message:
aodh: stop testing HBase and MongoDB on master/ocata

With Ocata, Aodh dropped the HBase and MongoDB drivers that were deprecated in
Newton. Therefore, stop running the tests for anything that is newer than
Newton.

Change-Id: I505c8673043fdf3745901a7bb43952db9643269f

commit_message:
Newer release notes are not traceable

Release notes in congress project page (/source/release.rst) have not been updated since Mitaka release.
This commit adds a link to OpenStack official release notes in a doc/source/release.rst

Change-Id: I4fcbb0e555176013ee16c1e2b52360b3b4da0f2a
Closes-Bug: #1633032
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/32/386432/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Newer release notes (after Mitaka) are published in OpenStack official release notes. To see the latest updates, please visit here: [OpenStack official release notes](http://docs.openstack.org/)

commit_message:
Add UT for compute manager

This patch add unit test cases for zun/compute/manager.py

Change-Id: I7a462c8f16ab5ff06236525e68494420d3dde55c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/13/387213/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from zun.common import exception from zun.compute import manager from zun.container.docker.driver import DockerDriver as docker_driver from zun.objects.container import Container from zun.objects import fields from zun.tests import base from zun.tests.unit.db import utils class TestManager(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestManager, self).setUp() self.compute_manager = manager.Manager() @mock.patch.object(Container, 'save') def test_fail_container(self, mock_save): container = Container(self.context, **utils.get_test_container()) self.compute_manager._fail_container(container) self.assertEqual(fields.ContainerStatus.ERROR, container.status) self.assertIsNone(container.task_state) def test_validate_container_state(self): container = Container(self.context, **utils.get_test_container()) container.status = 'Stopped' self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidStateException, self.compute_manager._validate_container_state, container, 'stop') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidStateException, self.compute_manager._validate_container_state, container, 'pause') container.status = 'Running' self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidStateException, self.compute_manager._validate_container_state, container, 'start') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidStateException, self.compute_manager._validate_container_state, container, 'unpause') @mock.patch.object(Container, 'save') @mock.patch.object(docker_driver, 'pull_image') @mock.patch.object(docker_driver, 'create') def test_container_create(self, mock_create, mock_pull, mock_save): container = Container(self.context, **utils.get_test_container()) self.compute_manager._do_container_create(self.context, container) mock_save.assert_called_with() mock_pull.assert_called_once_with(container.image) mock_create.assert_called_once_with(container) @mock.patch.object(Container, 'save') @mock.patch.object(docker_driver, 'pull_image') @mock.patch.object(manager.Manager, '_fail_container') def test_container_create_pull_image_failed(self, mock_fail, mock_pull, mock_save): container = Container(self.context, **utils.get_test_container()) mock_pull.side_effect = exception.DockerError self.compute_manager._do_container_create(self.context, container) mock_fail.assert_called_once_with(container) @mock.patch.object(Container, 'save') @mock.patch.object(docker_driver, 'create') **utils.get_test_container()) mock_create.side_effect = exception.DockerError self.compute_manager._do_container_create(self.context, container) mock_fail.assert_called_once_with(container) Container(self.context, **utils.get_test_container()) self.compute_manager.container_delete(self. context, container, False) mock_delete.assert_called_once_with(container, False) @mock.patch.object(manager.Manager, '_validate_container_state') def test_container_delete_invalid_state(self, mock_validate): container = Container(self.context, **utils.get_test_container()) mock_validate.side_effect = exception.InvalidStateException self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidStateException, self.compute_manager.container_delete, self.context, container, False) commit_message:
To improve the method parse_mappings in helpers

commit I993cbe8484db10d843e4711d966ed6661ef67848 add a unit test
for test_helpers, I think the ideal result should be {'key': 'val'}
not {'key': ['val']}, this patch fix it.

Change-Id: Idcb4aa4d9c0ff758eb0a0264365422840bb3480f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/22/385722/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key, value in mappings.items(): if isinstance(value,list) and len(value)==1: mappings[key] = ''.join(value)

commit_message:
db support batching policy

This patch focuses on db layer. Add a new
method for counting dependents that cluster
action depends on. Because batching policy
needs to guarantee 'min_in_service' nodes in
service. Will use number of dependents and
number of rest of nodes to calculate the
number of nodes in service in action-handler
layer.

Change-Id: Ice4cc21a29d044fcc7c2b6b793de4e7eb87b4a65
Implements: blueprint support-batching-policy
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/62/385462/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def action_count_dependents(context, action_id): with session_for_read() as session: q = session.query(models.ActionDependency) return q.filter_by(dependent=action_id).count()

form everywhere in the releases repo.

add pypy to the bindep "test" profile

According to the bindep docs

Also added a bindep env to tox.ini.

accommodate new oslo.config

new oslo.config enforces type. it should give warning but we uuid
type doesn't give ValueError or TypeError, which are caught. rather
it gives AttributeError

subject: Work around bad libvirt-python wheel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 13:46:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/537e0f5ce3696a4f2c28295c387ad427c4197d4c', 'message': 'Work around bad libvirt-python/pycparser wheels

The following packages must always build from source:

- libvirt-python:
  A pre-built wheel can be missing libvirt capabilities from the installed
  version of libvirt-bin, leading to nova-compute failing to start.

- pycparser:
  A pre-built wheel for pycparser may cause an Assertion error as shown
  in [1] and [2] - to work around this we ensure that we always compile it
  ourselves.

[1] https://github.com/eliben/pycparser/issues/147
[2] https://github.com/eliben/pycparser/issues/151
Closes-Bug: #1625859

Change-Id: I3197f06839c9705574810ab616dff51924435da5
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-18 19:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/repo_all.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/faf78e457ee2be33fa275c4622067b9220fae903', 'message': 'Work around bad libvirt-python wheel

The following package must always build from source:

- libvirt-python:
  A pre-built wheel can be missing libvirt capabilities
  from the installed version of libvirt-bin, leading to
  nova-compute failing to start.

The pycparser upper constraint override is removed as
the patch to make it compatible with upper constraints
has merged.

Closes-Bug: #1625859
Change-Id: I3197f06839c9705574810ab616dff51924435da5
'}]
commit_message:
Work around bad libvirt-python wheel

The following package must always build from source:

- libvirt-python:
  A pre-built wheel can be missing libvirt capabilities
  from the installed version of libvirt-bin, leading to
  nova-compute failing to start.

The pycparser upper constraint override is removed as
the patch to make it compatible with upper constraints
has merged.

Closes-Bug: #1625859
Change-Id: I3197f06839c9705574810ab616dff51924435da5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/27/388027/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ## Instruct the gate to always build libvirt-python from pip source repo_build_pip_no_binary: - libvirt-python # TODO(odyssey4me): # This is in place to resolve build issues with Rally due to # incompatibilities between its requirements and OpenStack # upper constraints. This may be removed when # https://review.openstack.org/385360 merges and the SHA's # are updated to include it. repo_build_upper_constraints_overrides: - pycparser<2.14

commit_message:
Do not extend lists in AIO config

Extending lists in openstack_user_config creates broken overrides,
because it will take the base AIO config and then, for example,
add your overrides to the list of cidr_networks, etc. By turning
off list extend we will have a usable path to override
the openstack_user_config file deployed by the AIO bootstrap role.

Change-Id: Ica90896dfb3f85bde869023ca9e2d4898d5f6201
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/24/388224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: list_extend: false

commit_message:
Passing eth0 to br-vlan

We've decided to give eth0 for openstack completely, so I think
we can give the eth0 raw interface into the br-vlan for vlan nets.

Change-Id: Ic8d431e73750d4134e860370745169471244be24

commit_message:
Fixes rabbitmq restart bug in Vivid

This change validates that rabbitmq-server isn't running or if it fails
to report a properly running service before trying to restart it

Change-Id: I7ef7e3366aa3ea91bcddfcf0400931635efdb3aa
Closes-Bug: #1460799
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/90/191090/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! $(pgrep -c rabbitmq-server 1>/dev/null ); then restart_service rabbitmq-server fi

commit_message:
Adds config-file arg option

Currently, the configurations are being loaded from a
statically defined file (/etc/monasca/agent/agent.yaml).

Adds CLI arg option for the configuration file (--config-file).
Also added this argument to the forwarder's tornado options, in
order to avoid exception due to unrecognised argument.

Co-Authored-By: Craig Bryant <craig.bryant@hpe.com>

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-windows-support

Change-Id: I400fdb3db6562a7171ecadcb27ee63ae4eaf8006

subject: Properly find tarball for NPM packages we publish
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 21:37:21.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/javascript.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/00ed8dd66e4755dc0dcc8a6d81cff4b4e8970470', 'message': 'Properly find tarball for NPM packages we publish

For js-openstack-lib project, the tarball name is
"openstack-lib-$VER.tgz" and not "js-openstack-lib-$VER.tgz" as we
want to publish the packge without the "js-" prefix.
In order to publish properly, this patch introduce a less restrictive
regex to find the tarball name to publish.

Change-Id: Iffbd40701960b754184eda438436b56b8d87cefa
'}]
commit_message:
Properly find tarball for NPM packages we publish

For js-openstack-lib project, the tarball name is
"openstack-lib-$VER.tgz" and not "js-openstack-lib-$VER.tgz" as we
want to publish the packge without the "js-" prefix.
In order to publish properly, this patch introduce a less restrictive
regex to find the tarball name to publish.

Change-Id: Iffbd40701960b754184eda438436b56b8d87cefa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/11/388911/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use BaseDbObjectTestCase in AddressScope UT

AddressScopeDbObjectTestCase class is using _BaseObjectTestCase class
which doesn't contain all the unit test cases for Oslo-Versioned
classes. This patch replace that class.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Change-Id: I180046743471487a9f9a6e53ae0f2fd09afdf123

commit_message:
Create snapshot of VM

When the storage for an instance is hosted from the Novalink
partition, additional mappings are not required to be created.
Instead, search the management partition for scsi mappings
containing the boot disk for the instance and use the backing
device for that mapping.

Closes-bug: 1635025
Change-Id: I9937060e0a60984a8489939a6e18a6e7eb420500

The --no-binary CLI option needs to be provided multiple

Change-Id: I2ef206a93e82f0510289a17db98500af85029f88

commit_message:
Ensure no-binary list translates to CLI options properly

The --no-binary CLI option needs to be provided multiple
times - one for each package. A comma-delimited list does
not work.

This patch ensures that the options are provided properly.

Change-Id: I2ef206a93e82f0510289a17db98500af85029f88

commit_message:
Create snapshot of VM

When the storage for an instance is hosted from the Novalink
partition, additional mappings are not required to be created.
Instead, search the management partition for scsi mappings
containing the boot disk for the instance and use the backing
device for that mapping.

Closes-bug: 1635025
Change-Id: I9937060e0a60984a8489939a6e18a6e7eb420500
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/90/388890/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def boot_disk_path_for_instance(self, instance, vios_uuid): """Find scsi mappings on given vios for the instance. This method finds all scsi mappings on a given vios that are associated with the instance and disk_type. :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object owning the requested disk. :param disk_type: The type of disk to find, one of the DiskType enum values. :param lpar_wrap: pypowervm.wrappers.logical_partition.LPAR corresponding to the instance. If not specified, it will be retrieved; i.e. specify this parameter to save on REST calls. :return: Iterator of scsi mappings that are associated with the instance and disk_type. """ vm_uuid = vm.get_pvm_uuid(instance) match_func = self.disk_match_func(DiskType.BOOT, instance) vios_wrap = pvm_vios.VIOS.get(self.adapter, uuid=vios_uuid, xag=[pvm_const.XAG.VIO_SMAP]) maps = tsk_map.find_maps(vios_wrap.scsi_mappings, client_lpar_id=vm_uuid, match_func=match_func) if maps: return maps[0].server_adapter.backing_dev_name return None

commit_message:
Refactor _test_build_pxe_config_options tests

This auxiliary method to set up mocks correctly
is becoming more complex than the thing it tests.

This patch splits it in two auxiliary mock setup methods,
for pxe and ipxe cases respectively.

Change-Id: Ia31f482c1b88c98feedd0e76414b2178ac7f1b8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/42/367142/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: boot_opt_mock.assert_called_once_with(self.node) def _test_build_pxe_config_options_pxe(self, build_pxe_mock, whle_dsk_img=False): deploy_kernel = os.path.join(CONF.pxe.tftp_root, self.node.uuid, 'deploy_kernel') deploy_ramdisk = os.path.join(CONF.pxe.tftp_root, self.node.uuid, 'deploy_ramdisk') kernel = os.path.join(CONF.pxe.tftp_root, self.node.uuid, 'kernel') ramdisk = os.path.join(CONF.pxe.tftp_root, self.node.uuid, 'ramdisk') root_dir = CONF.pxe.tftp_root image_info = { 'deploy_kernel': ('deploy_kernel', os.path.join(root_dir, self.node.uuid, 'deploy_kernel')), 'deploy_ramdisk': ('deploy_ramdisk', os.path.join(root_dir, self.node.uuid, 'deploy_ramdisk')) } if (whle_dsk_img or deploy_utils.get_boot_option(self.node) == 'local'): ramdisk = 'no_ramdisk' kernel = 'no_kernel' else: image_info.update({ 'kernel': ('kernel_id', os.path.join(root_dir, self.node.uuid, 'kernel')), 'ramdisk': ('ramdisk_id', os.path.join(root_dir, self.node.uuid, 'ramdisk')) }) expected_options = { 'ari_path': ramdisk, 'deployment_ari_path': deploy_ramdisk, 'pxe_append_params': 'test_param', 'aki_path': kernel, 'deployment_aki_path': deploy_kernel, 'tftp_server': tftp_server, 'ipxe_timeout': 0, } with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=True) as task: options = pxe._build_pxe_config_options(task, image_info) self.assertEqual(expected_options, options) def test__build_pxe_config_options_pxe(self): self._test_build_pxe_config_options_pxe(whle_dsk_img=True) def test__build_pxe_config_options_pxe_local_boot(self): del self.node.driver_internal_info['is_whole_disk_image'] i_info = self.node.instance_info i_info.update({'capabilities': {'boot_option': 'local'}}) self.node.instance_info = i_info self.node.save() self._test_build_pxe_config_options_pxe(whle_dsk_img=False) def test__build_pxe_config_options_pxe_without_is_whole_disk_image(self): del self.node.driver_internal_info['is_whole_disk_image'] self.node.save() self._test_build_pxe_config_options_pxe(whle_dsk_img=False) def test__build_pxe_config_options_pxe_no_kernel_no_ramdisk(self): del self.node.driver_internal_info['is_whole_disk_image'] self.node.save() self.config(group='pxe', tftp_server='my-tftp-server') self.config(group='pxe', pxe_append_params='my-pxe-append-params') image_info = { 'deploy_kernel': ('deploy_kernel', 'path-to-deploy_kernel'), 'deploy_ramdisk': ('deploy_ramdisk', 'path-to-deploy_ramdisk')} with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=True) as task: options = pxe._build_pxe_config_options(task, image_info) expected_options = { 'deployment_aki_path': 'path-to-deploy_kernel', 'deployment_ari_path': 'path-to-deploy_ramdisk', 'pxe_append_params': 'my-pxe-append-params', 'tftp_server': 'my-tftp-server', 'aki_path': 'no_kernel', 'ari_path': 'no_ramdisk', 'ipxe_timeout': 0} self.assertEqual(expected_options, options) @mock.patch('ironic.common.image_service.GlanceImageService', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(pxe_utils, '_build_pxe_config', autospec=True) def _test_build_pxe_config_options_ipxe(self, build_pxe_mock, glance_mock, whle_dsk_img=False, ipxe_timeout=0, ipxe_use_swift=False): self.config(pxe_append_params='test_param', group='pxe') # NOTE: right '/' should be removed from url string self.config(api_url='http://192.168.122.184:6385', group='conductor') self.config(ipxe_timeout=ipxe_timeout, group='pxe') root_dir = CONF.deploy.http_root driver_internal_info = self.node.driver_internal_info driver_internal_info['is_whole_disk_image'] = whle_dsk_img self.node.driver_internal_info = driver_internal_info self.node.save() tftp_server = CONF.pxe.tftp_server http_url = 'http://192.1.2.3:1234' self.config(ipxe_enabled=True, group='pxe') self.config(http_url=http_url, group='deploy') if ipxe_use_swift: self.config(ipxe_use_swift=True, group='pxe') glance = mock.Mock() glance_mock.return_value = glance glance.swift_temp_url.side_effect = [ deploy_kernel, deploy_ramdisk] = [ 'swift_kernel', 'swift_ramdisk'] deploy_kernel = os.path.join(http_url, It provides a Python API (the solumclient module) and a command-line tool (solum). %package doc Summary: Documentation for OpenStack Solum API client libary Group: Documentation BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('Sphinx') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('oslosphinx') }} %description doc Client library for Solum built on the Solum API. It provides a Python API (the solumclient module) and a command-line tool (solum). commit_message:
Speed up local deployment

Following commits embraces GIT_DEPTH flag
from devstack and sets it to 1.

This change removed cloning entire repositories
and goes into shallow clone concept. However
only recent commit is required to get
proper status of given repo.

Change-Id: I4dfa4c2cdb76cdf18bf57af10b3fd6aa57aaafce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/95/387195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add ServiceBinary Enum

This change adds a new enum and field, ServiceBinaryField
that will hold the constants for the binary field of the Service
object. This enum field are based off the base oslo.versionedobjects
enum and field. This also changes over the service object to use the
new field and bumps the version so newer versions know to enforce valid
values. Finally, all uses of strings for comparison and assignment
to this field are changed over to use the constants defined within the
enum.

The main purpose is enforce a centralized & valid set of constant values
for various ovo object field types.

Change-Id: Id2453cb3939dbb506759f1a1fa0822a2cd1dfedf
Partial-Implements: bp cinder-object-fields

commit_message:
Update signing key for percona packages

Percona has started signing their Ubuntu packages with a new key.
Update the galera_gpg_keys var to add it to the keyring.

https://www.percona.com/blog/2016/10/13/new-signing-key-for-percona-debian-and-ubuntu-packages/

This was fixed for galera server in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/388501/ this patch is for galera
client only.

Change-Id: Ia2a5c5fdfb6947b4b3254157cf33126a7edfdd5f
Related-Bug: #388205

subject: Automatically source the rc file for ansible/ansible-playbook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 16:19:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/2fda1b7d462c95049de7be56db4a42b5495e27a3', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

For Newton onwards, any Ansible commands run (ansible, ansible-galaxy,
etc) the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file needs to be sourced
before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have failed
because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook' instead of
'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that all Ansible commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is always sourced
and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are always included as
extra vars for the right commands.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-14 16:35:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a369e107e410b0ce0c11551f373130281c5bf095', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

For Newton onwards, any Ansible commands run (ansible, ansible-galaxy,
etc) the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file needs to be sourced
before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have failed
because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook' instead of
'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that all Ansible commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is always sourced
and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are always included as
extra vars for the right commands.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-14 16:40:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/fdf8129227b3c00e3d2e505ff484d0d123610300', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

For Newton onwards, any Ansible commands run (ansible, ansible-galaxy,
etc) the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file needs to be sourced
before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have failed
because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook' instead of
'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that all Ansible commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is always sourced
and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are always included as
extra vars for the right commands.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is before
all other parameters.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-14 16:42:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/faabe07a0d2c42c7697d5fbb86a5f1dadf042253', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

This patch ensures that all Ansible commands execute using the

and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are always included as

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is before
all other parameters.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-14 16:52:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/abf470650182727c79310581c6a6924ad22451e5', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

This patch ensures that all Ansible commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is always sourced
and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are always included as
extra vars for the right commands.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is before
all other parameters.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-14 18:50:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/ca52991795b30e88dae79cdadca1268e08918bfe', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

For Newton onwards, any Ansible commands run (ansible, ansible-galaxy,
etc) the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file needs to be sourced
before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have failed
because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook' instead of
'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that all Ansible commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is always sourced
and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are always included as
extra vars for the right commands.

The only happens is the execution is done from the git clone root
directory, or when the openstack-ansible command is invoked. This
protection has been added in order to ensure that non-OSA execution
is not interfered with.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is before
all other parameters.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-14 18:55:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/22028db415811886b684d8c33d6c703e12bea172', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

For Newton onwards, any Ansible commands run (ansible, ansible-galaxy,
etc) the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file needs to be sourced
before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have failed
because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook' instead of
'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that all Ansible commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is always sourced
and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are always included as
extra vars for the right commands.

The only happens is the execution is done from the git clone root
directory, or when the openstack-ansible command is invoked. This
protection has been added in order to ensure that non-OSA execution
is not interfered with.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is before
all other parameters.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-10-17 11:00:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/9c8c615e3cef856a028257b94179943cb1d4d9ce', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

For Newton onwards, when both ansible and ansible-playbook
commands are run the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file
needs to be sourced before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have
failed because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook'
instead of 'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that both these commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is sourced
appropriately and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are
included as extra vars under the right circumstances.

The wrapper only implements the sourced config and extra vars if
the ansible/ansible-playbook commands are executed from the git
clone root directory. This protection has been added in order to
ensure that non-OSA execution is not interfered with.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is before
all other parameters.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-17 11:06:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/c807e7e2a982e1ac2da39cda67d9fb35b4ee6989', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for all Ansible commands

commands are run the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file
needs to be sourced before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have
failed because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook'
instead of 'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that both these commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is sourced
appropriately and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are
included as extra vars under the right circumstances.

The wrapper only implements the sourced config and extra vars if
the ansible/ansible-playbook commands are executed from the git
clone root directory. This protection has been added in order to
ensure that non-OSA execution is not interfered with.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the

For Newton onwards, when both ansible and ansible-playbook
commands are run the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file
needs to be sourced before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have
failed because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook'
instead of 'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that both these commands execute using the

appropriately and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are
included as extra vars under the right circumstances.

The wrapper only implements the sourced config and extra vars if
the ansible/ansible-playbook commands are executed from the git

ensure that non-OSA execution is not interfered with.

order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is before

commit_message:
Automatically source the rc file for ansible/ansible-playbook

For Newton onwards, when both ansible and ansible-playbook
commands are run the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file
needs to be sourced before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have
failed because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook'
instead of 'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that both these commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is sourced
appropriately and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are
included as extra vars under the right circumstances.

The wrapper only implements the sourced config and extra vars if
the ansible/ansible-playbook commands are executed from the git
clone root directory. This protection has been added in order to
ensure that non-OSA execution is not interfered with.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
order of parameters is changed to ensure that the playbook is
before all other parameters.

Change-Id: I6706dcca6046addb57733b53bc1610644bcbb2d1
Closes-Bug: #1633411
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/80/386680/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pushd /opt/ansible-runtime/bin for ansible_bin in $(ls -1 ansible*); do ln -sf /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible /usr/local/bin/${ansible_bin} done /opt/ansible-runtime/bin/ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file="${ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE}" \ /opt/ansible-runtime/bin/ansible-playbook \ -i "localhost ansible-connection=local," \# Source the Ansible configuration. . /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc # Figure out which Ansible binary was executed RUN_CMD=\$(basename \${0}) # Execute the Ansible command. if [ "\${RUN_CMD}" == "ansible" ] || [ "\${RUN_CMD}" == "ansible-playbook" ]; then /opt/ansible-runtime/bin/\${RUN_CMD} \${VAR1} \$@ else /opt/ansible-runtime/bin/\${RUN_CMD} \$@ fi
deleted_lines: pushd /usr/local/bin find /opt/ansible-runtime/bin/ -name 'ansible*' -exec ln -sf {} \; ansible-galaxy install --role-file="${ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE}" \ ansible-playbook -i "localhost ansible-connection=local," \# Run the ansible playbook command. . /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc && \$(which ansible-playbook) \${VAR1} \$@

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I3c5c7368fb006f3691d07cef9557c20a42cc5b76

commit_message:
[WIP] - Extend Extras Functionality

This will utilize the existing "extras" field to allow administrators/
operators to store key/value pairs to domains, projects, and tenants
within Keystone, providing this through an API to specified roles

Change-Id: Iee3a58138bae9f20588ea9205e018cd6f06cf24c
Co-Authored-By: jaugustine <ja224e@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/39/343939/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================ Expand interaction with extras field in domains and projects ============================================================ `bp domains-projects-metadata <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/ domains-projects-metadata>`_ Create a method for administrators/operators to interact more directly with the extras field in projects/domains, adding a new API call to allow for the storage and modification of information using key/value pairs within the extras field for domains, projects, and tenants (v2.0) Problem Description =================== There is a need to store additional company specific metadata for some Identity elements. There is currently an extension being maintained outside of Keystone that adds this functionality. This concept is modeled off the Instance Metadata work within Nova. Proposed Change =============== Create an API call within keystone to add/get/update/remove values from a JSON object that will be stored within the extras field. Keystone would need to be able to pull the extras string from the table, parse the JSON, then allow for values to be added/changed/removed, then store the JSON data back into extras as a string. Alternatives ------------ Modifying the database itself to store this data. Security Impact --------------- None. Notifications Impact -------------------- There will be additional notifications to the API calls. Other End User Impact --------------------- This should only affect an administrator and/or users with specified roles as designated by the administrator. Performance Impact ------------------ There will be an additional database connection, any performance impact will be the additional calls for read/write of metadata for any domains/projects. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None. Developer Impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Jeffrey Augustine - ja224e@att.com (IRC jaugustine) Other contributors: Gage Hugo - gh159m@att.com (IRC gagehugo) Work Items ---------- Add API calls to Keystone to allow for the modification of extras for domains, projects, and tenants (v2). Dependencies ============ None. Documentation Impact ==================== Will need to add documentation on how to use this feature. API Calls ========= Domains ------- Metadata related to Domains of the OpenStack Identity API. **List all data in extras for Domain** Lists all data that exist within the extras field for the specified domain. **Request:** ``GET /v3/domains/{domain_id}/extras`` **Parameters** * domain_id - String UUID ``domain_id`` of the Domain (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) **Response** .. code:: JSON { "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3", "key4": "value4", "key5": "value5" } **Get value from key from extras in Domain** **Request:** ``GET /v3/domains/{domain_id}/extras/{key}`` **Parameters** * domain_id - String UUID ``domain_id`` of the Domain (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** .. code:: JSON { "key": "example value" } **Create/Update value with specified key in extras for Domain** Creates/Updates the value with the given key in extras for the specified Domain. Other existing keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``PUT /v3/domains/{domain_id}/extras/{key}`` .. code:: JSON "example value" **Parameters** * domain_id - String UUID ``domain_id`` of the Domain (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** ``Status Code: 200 OK`` **Change value(s) with key(s) in extras for Domain** Changes the value(s) of the given key(s) within the extras field for the specified domain. Any omitted keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``POST /v3/domains/{domain_id}/extras`` .. code:: JSON { "key1": "new value", "key2": "new value 2" } **Parameters** * domain_id - String UUID ``domain_id`` of the Domain (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) **Response** ``Status Code: 200 OK`` **Remove key/value from extras for Domain** Change the value(s) of the given key(s) within the extras field to empty, which will signal to remove them from the JSON string in extras. Any omitted keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``DELETE /v3/domains/{domain_id}/extras/{key}`` * domain_id - String UUID ``domain_id`` of the Domain (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) **Response** ``Status Code: 204 No Content`` Projects -------- Extras data related to Projects of the OpenStack Identity API. **List all data in extras for Project** Lists all data that exist within the extras field for the specified project. **Request:** ``GET /v3/projects/{project_id}/extras`` **Parameters** * project_id - String UUID ``project_id`` of the Project (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) **Response** .. code:: JSON { "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3", "key4": "value4", "key5": "value5" } **Get value from key from extras in Project** **Request:** ``GET /v3/projects/{project_id}/extras/{key}`` **Parameters** * project_id - String UUID ``project_id`` of the Domain (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** .. code:: JSON { "key": "example value" } **Create/Update value with specified key in extras for Project** Creates/Updates the value with the given key in extras for the specified project. Other existing keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``PUT /v3/projects/{project_id}/extras/{key}`` .. code:: JSON "example value" **Parameters** * project_id - String UUID ``project_id`` of the Project (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** ``Status Code: 200 OK`` **Change value(s) with key(s) in extras for Project** Changes the value(s) of the given key(s) within the extras field for the specified project. Any omitted keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``POST /v3/projects/{project_id}/extras`` .. code:: JSON { "key1": "new value", "key2": "new value 2" } **Parameters** * project_id - String UUID ``project_id`` of the Project (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) **Response** ``Status Code: 200 OK`` **Remove key/value from extras for Project** Change the value(s) of the given key(s) within the extras field to empty, which will signal to remove them from the JSON string in extras. Any omitted keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``DELETE /v3/projects/{project_id}/extras/{key}`` * project_id - String UUID ``project_id`` of the Project (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** ``Status Code: 204 No Content`` Tenants -------- Extras data related to Tenants of the OpenStack Identity API. **List all data in extras for Tenant** Lists all data that exist within the extras field for the specified tenant. **Request:** ``GET /v2.0/tenants/{tenant_id}/extras`` **Parameters** * tenant_id - String UUID ``tenant_id`` of the Tenant (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) **Response** .. code:: JSON { "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3", "key4": "value4", "key5": "value5" } **Get value from key from extras in Tenant** **Request:** ``GET /v2.0/tenants/{tenant_id}/extras/{key}`` **Parameters** * tenant_id - String UUID ``tenant_id`` of the Domain (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** .. code:: JSON { "key": "example value" } **Create/Update value with specified key in extras for Tenant** Creates/Updates the value with the given key in extras for the specified tenant. Other existing keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``PUT /v2.0/tenants/{tenant_id}/extras/{key}`` .. code:: JSON "example value" **Parameters** * tenant_id - String UUID ``tenant_id`` of the Tenant (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** ``Status Code: 200 OK`` **Change value(s) with key(s) in extras for Tenant** Changes the value(s) of the given key(s) within the extras field for the specified tenant. Any omitted keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``POST /v2.0/tenants/{tenant_id}/extras`` .. code:: JSON { "key1": "new value", "key2": "new value 2" } **Parameters** * tenant_id - String UUID ``tenant_id`` of the Tenant (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) **Response** ``Status Code: 200 OK`` **Remove key/value from extras for Tenant** Change the value(s) of the given key(s) within the extras field to empty, which will signal to remove them from the JSON string in extras. Any omitted keys will not be changed. **Request:** ``DELETE /v2.0/tenants/{tenant_id}/extras/{key}`` * tenant_id - String UUID ``tenant_id`` of the Tenant (ex:4d053ce37eeb4de580a6ab78b754fe63) * key - String ``key`` of the value in extras **Response** ``Status Code: 204 No Content`` References ========== Nova metadata `<http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html #server-extras-v2.1>`_

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Id0bab5c90d119bec40d1c745203d0c89ad7096f3

commit_message:
Ensure testing is against current commit

By using the centralized testing repo and its ansible.cfg file, a git
clone of the plugins repo is made to ~/.ansible/ and used for testing.
Effectively, testing of plugins is only done against the last merged
commit.

Set environment variables through tox so that ansible uses the library
and plugin paths in tree.

Change-Id: I61d60ae997d1bbcfdfa154a68908f7131ebc11c3
(cherry picked from commit 0c964ebedcbfd4e999d4c626c81b92dffbd9ad3e)

commit_message:
[simulator] Fix a message length generator usage

Do initialization of the generator only for rpc/notify clients.
No needs to load messages_length.yaml and calculate distribution for servers.

Change-Id: Ib1ac30181bec20eacf6d29ccd5f76c0b6b1e96f8

deleted_lines: RANDOM_GENERATOR = None for i in six.moves.range(messages_count): length = RANDOM_GENERATOR() RANDOM_GENERATOR = init_random_generator()

subject: Enable neutron to work in a multi node setup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-14 14:03:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/0e4b7e6be674517790350335ef978f6107ac37c0', 'message': 'Enable neutron to work in a multi node setup

Ont eh controller node where devstack is being run should create
the neutron network. The compute node should not.

The the case that we want to run a multi-node neutron setup we need
to configure the following (in the case that a plugin does not
have any agents running on the compute node):
ENABLED_SERVICES=n-cpu,neutron

This patch ensure that the multi-node support works.

Change-Id: I8e80edd453a1106ca666d6c531b2433be631bce4
Closes-bug: #1613069
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-15 11:40:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/c34d22a7928900f65206cf8a6b2fe38be675345c', 'message': 'Enable neutron to work in a multi node setup

On the controller node where devstack is being run should create
the neutron network. The compute node should not.

The the case that we want to run a multi-node neutron setup we need

commit_message:
Enable neutron to work in a multi node setup

On the controller node where devstack is being run should create
the neutron network. The compute node should not.

The the case that we want to run a multi-node neutron setup we need
to configure the following (in the case that a plugin does not
have any agents running on the compute node):
ENABLED_SERVICES=n-cpu,neutron

In addition to this the code did not enable decomposed plugins to
configure their nova configurations if necessary.

This patch ensure that the multi-node support works.

Change-Id: I8e80edd453a1106ca666d6c531b2433be631bce4
Closes-bug: #1613069

commit_message:
Fix local deployment

It turns out that granting of permissions
in database is possible only from localhost.

For that reason the gate is passing, because
MYSQL_HOST there is equal to localhost. Therefore
following changes moves granting permissions
outside of the schema file directly inside the
plugin.sh.

Had to move loading schema into post-config phase
after devstack has mysql properly configured. However
that also required deffering starting of the services.

Change-Id: I5fad26075cf4521293e1b77307f9fbe98c840f54

This process will fail on schema changes."###### extra functions function recreate_users { local db=$1 local users=$2 local hosts=$3 recreate_users_$DATABASE_TYPE $db $users $hosts } function recreate_users_mysql { local db=$1 for user in ${users[*]}; do for host in ${hosts[*]}; do # loading grants needs to be done from localhost and by root at this very point # after loading schema is moved to post-config it could be possible to this as # DATABASE_USER mysql -uroot -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -h127.0.0.1 -e "GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON $db.* TO '$user'@'$host' identified by 'password';" done done }

commit_message:
Remove publish from build-images playbook

We removed the publish role[1], but it was still referenced in the image
building playbook (even though it was never used).

mock_auth_utils.get_client_session.assert_called_with( conf=heat_stack.CONF.heat) @mock.patch.object(heat_stack, 'auth_utils') def test_get_token_client(self, mock_auth_utils): token_client = hs._get_token_client() self.assertIsNotNone(token_client) self.assertEqual("<class 'heatclient.v1.client.Client'>", str(token_client.__class__)) mock_auth_utils.get_token_client_session.assert_called_with( conf=heat_stack.CONF.heat) def test_wait_state(self): hs = heat_stack.HeatStack('test-stack', None) hs._client.stacks.get.return_value =\ mock.Mock(stack_status='CREATE_COMPLETE') result = hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'CREATE_COMPLETE') self.assertEqual({}, result) def test_wait_state_with_outputs(self): hs = heat_stack.HeatStack('test-stack', None) hs._client.stacks.get.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(stack_status='IN_PROGRESS'), mock.Mock(stack_status='CREATE_COMPLETE', outputs=[{'output_key': 'key1', 'output_value': 'val1'}, {'output_key': 'key2', 'output_value': 'val2'}]) ] result = hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'CREATE_COMPLETE') self.assertNotEqual({}, result) self.assertEqual({'key1': 'val1', 'key2': 'val2'}, result) def test_wait_state_with_multiple_states(self): """Test that only the first state is checked.""" hs = heat_stack.HeatStack('test-stack', None) hs._client.stacks.get.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(stack_status=['IN_PROGRESS', 'NOT_FOUND']), mock.Mock(stack_status='CREATE_COMPLETE') ] result = hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'CREATE_COMPLETE') self.assertEqual({}, result) @mock.patch.object(heat_stack, 'eventlet') def test_wait_state_with_wait_progress_true(self, mock_eventlet): hs = heat_stack.HeatStack('test-stack', None) hs._last_stack_timestamps = ('creation_time', 'updated_time') hs._client.stacks.get.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(stack_status='TEST_STATUS', creation_time='creation_time', updated_time='updated_time'), mock.Mock(stack_status='TEST_STATUS', creation_time='creation_time', updated_time='updated_time'), mock.Mock(stack_status='CREATE_COMPLETE') ] result = hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'CREATE_COMPLETE', wait_progress=True) self.assertEqual({}, result) self.assertEqual(3, hs._client.stacks.get.call_count) self.assertEqual(2, mock_eventlet.sleep.call_count) expected_calls = [mock.call.sleep(2), mock.call.sleep(2)] self.assertEqual(expected_calls, mock_eventlet.sleep.mock_calls) def test_wait_state_except_http_not_found(self): hs = heat_stack.HeatStack('test-stack', None) hs._client.stacks.get.side_effect = heat_stack.heat_exc.HTTPNotFound # If NOT FOUND is the expected status, then should run successfully. result = hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'NOT_FOUND') self.assertEqual({}, result) # Else EnvironmentError should be thrown. expected_error_msg = "Unexpected stack state {0}"\ .format('NOT_FOUND') with self.assertRaisesRegexp(EnvironmentError, expected_error_msg): hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'CREATE_COMPLETE') @mock.patch.object(heat_stack, 'eventlet') def test_wait_state_except_general_exception(self, mock_eventlet): """Test whether 4 tries are executed before exception raised.""" hs = heat_stack.HeatStack('test-stack', None) hs._client.stacks.get.side_effect = Exception('test_exception_msg') with self.assertRaisesRegexp(Exception, 'test_exception_msg'): hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'CREATE_COMPLETE') expected_calls = [mock.call.sleep(2), mock.call.sleep(4), mock.call.sleep(8)] self.assertEqual(4, hs._client.stacks.get.call_count) self.assertEqual(3, mock_eventlet.sleep.call_count) self.assertEqual(expected_calls, mock_eventlet.sleep.mock_calls) def test_wait_state_except_environment_error(self): hs = heat_stack.HeatStack('test-stack', None) hs._client.stacks.get.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(stack_status='IN_PROGRESS'), mock.Mock(stack_status='UNEXPECTED_STATUS', stack_status_reason='test_reason') ] expected_error_msg = "Unexpected stack state {0}: {1}"\ .format('UNEXPECTED_STATUS', 'test_reason') with self.assertRaisesRegexp(EnvironmentError, expected_error_msg): hs._wait_state(lambda status: status == 'CREATE_COMPLETE')

commit_message:

commit_message:
Install Couchbase SDK for scenario test client

Install the CBC (Couchbase C client library) and Python bindings.

Install in kick-start to make sure it works on the gate as well as
manually kick-started environments.

Change-Id: I57bf3c8d0bc04557eb9183e1a9a6983af3451cc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/96/356696/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DATASTORE_TYPE=$1 if [ "$DATASTORE_TYPE" = "couchbase" ] || [ "$DATASTORE_TYPE" = "couchbase_4" ] || [ "$DATASTORE_TYPE" = "couchbase_ee" ]; then # Install Couchbase SDK for scenario tests. sudo -H $HTTP_PROXY curl http://packages.couchbase.com/ubuntu/couchbase.key | sudo apt-key add - echo "deb http://packages.couchbase.com/ubuntu trusty trusty/main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/couchbase-csdk.list sudo -H $HTTP_PROXY apt-get update sudo -H $HTTP_PROXY apt-get -y install libcouchbase-dev sudo -H $HTTP_PROXY pip install --upgrade couchbase fi install_test_packages $1

commit_message:
Avoid Forcing the Translation of Translatable Variables

Whenever possible translation should not be forced by use of
six.text_type() on a message being used with a format string.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#avoid-forcing-the-translation-of-translatable-variables

Change-Id: I37e0ef5dce7829c3e0fa6381b8530d0e75326344

commit_message:
Fixes missing provider mappings for OpenDaylight

Provider mappings were not parameterized, and this is traditionally
required for VLAN provider networks.  In ODL Boron with new netvirt,
this value is required to be set in order to use external networks.

Closes-Bug: #1627898

Change-Id: I8001a4077fc7c4af458033043ea438c32c9772b0
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 32d7c52bf8a7abb851994c36a846f1770ad5068a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/37/386737/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenDaylightProviderMappings: description: Mappings between logical networks and physical interfaces. Required for VLAN deployments. For example physnet1 -> eth1. type: comma_delimited_list default: "datacentre:br-ex" neutron::plugins::ovs::opendaylight::provider_mappings: str_replace: template: MAPPINGS params: MAPPINGS: {get_param: OpenDaylightProviderMappings}
