commit_message:
Support searchlight ansible role

Searchlight is an Openstack search and index service, this patch
implements the ansible role for searchlight.

Implement blueprint: support-searchlight-deployment

Change-Id: Ibf42d5b259a6740d6596041f896e1009657b7388
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/62/387862/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [DEFAULT] debug = {{ searchlight_logging_debug }} policy_file = /etc/searchlight/policy.json log_dir = /var/log/kolla/searchlight rpc_backend = rabbit [api] port = {{ searchlight_api_port }} bind_host = {{ hostvars[inventory_hostname]['ansible_' + api_interface]['ipv4']['address'] }} public_endpoint = {{ internal_protocol }}://{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname]['ansible_' + api_interface]['ipv4']['address'] }}:{{ searchlight_api_port }} [elasticsearch] hosts = {{ searchlight_elasticsearch_url }} [listener] workers = {{ openstack_service_workers }} notifications_pool = searchlight-listener [paste_deploy] flavor = keystone [keystone_authtoken] memcached_servers = {{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ memcached_port }} auth_uri = {{ internal_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ keystone_public_port }} project_domain_name = default project_name = service user_domain_name = default username = {{ searchlight_keystone_user }} password = {{ searchlight_keystone_password }} auth_url = {{ admin_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ keystone_admin_port }} auth_type = password [service_credentials] memcached_servers = {{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ memcached_port }} auth_uri = {{ internal_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ keystone_public_port }} region_name = {{ openstack_region_name }} project_domain_name = default project_name = service user_domain_name = default username = {{ searchlight_keystone_user }} password = {{ searchlight_keystone_password }} auth_url = {{ admin_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ keystone_admin_port }} auth_type = password auth_plugin = password [oslo_messaging_rabbit] rabbit_userid = {{ rabbitmq_user }} rabbit_password = {{ rabbitmq_password }} rabbit_ha_queues = true rabbit_hosts = {% for host in groups['rabbitmq'] %}{{ hostvars[host]['ansible_' + hostvars[host]['api_interface']]['ipv4']['address'] }}:{{ rabbitmq_port }}{% if not loop.last commit_message:
Update puppet-mongodb tag

Tag 0.13.0 doesn't support systemd on ubuntu
so we need to use 0.14.0 tag

commit_message:
Drop unused import cfg

The cfg have not been used in these models, so we should drop it.
And I I have looked at the whole project. No other similar needs
to be modified.

Change-Id: Idead576f8c905b3dddb3b402aee9177431a578ca

commit_message:
Spec for VXLAN Support for OVS-DPDK

Change-Id: I74754f645695a89dcf0181d50cce2c0359b7cf70
Blueprint: vxlan-support-for-ovs-dpdk
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/06/374206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== VXLAN support for OVS-DPDK ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/vxlan-support-for-ovs-dpdk We want to utilize VXLAN based networking with OVS/DPDK for high performance scale-able tenant networking. -------------------- Problem description -------------------- Currently we can use OVS-DPDK only with VLAN based network segmentation. It would be good to have an opportunity of supporting VXLAN with OVS-DPDK. It is very important for all NFV use cases. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- The proposal is to enable interface `br-prv` on `br-prv` bridge and to use this bridge for the tunneling instead of `br-mesh`. Web UI ====== None Nailgun ======= We have to remove restrictions for using DPDK mode only with VLAN based segmentation and have to use endpoint as in the VLAN case. Data model ---------- When operator configures interface as DPDK to use it for Private network and segmentation type is VXLAN, `astute.yaml` will be extended as following * Endpoint for Private network should be `br-prv` instead of `br-mesh`:: network_scheme: endpoint: - br-prv REST API -------- None Orchestration ============= None Fuel Client =========== None Plugins ======= None Fuel Library ============ We have to enable interface `br-prv` on `br-prv` bridge. .. code-block:: bash ifconfig br-prv <IP/MASK> up ------------ Alternatives ------------ Continue to use VLAN base network segmentation. -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- None --------------- Security impact --------------- None -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- None --------------- End user impact --------------- None ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ Performance penalties are not expected. ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- None ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- None --------------------- Infrastructure impact --------------------- This feature will be tested on virtual environment. -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- The user guide should be updated according to the described feature. -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: Anastasia Balobashina <atolochkova@mirantis.com> Work Items ========== * Add possibility for using DPDK mode with VXLAN segmentation type * Remove utilization of `br-mesh` bridge in case of tunneling segmentation * Enable interface `br-prv` on `br-prv` bridge with appropriate ip and mask * Test manually * Create a system test for DPDK Dependencies ============ None ------------ Testing, QA ------------ * Test API/CLI cases for the configuring DPDK with VXLAN segmentation * Test WEB UI cases for the configuring DPDK with VXLAN segmentation * Test that DPDK with VXLAN segmentation is discovered and configured properly Acceptance criteria =================== * Ability to run a DPDK application on top of OVS/DPDK + VXLAN enabled host * Achieve 80% of wire speed * Working on 40 gig and 2x10 cards from Intel's forteville family ---------- References ---------- None

commit_message:
Wait for a config drive device to be available

A failure may occur if the dd to config drive partition happens
before it actually becomes available. This change adds a udevadm
settle call that ensures that config drive device is present in
/dev folder.

Closes-Bug: #1633063
Change-Id: I5526f791371e7a6f4cdad151bb163707504e76cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib refs/changes/64/387664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IS_PARTITION_CREATED_CHECK_INTERVAL = 5 # NOTE(vdrok): No timeout here, the partition was created # successfully, let's wait for it. If we'll break the loop, # the deployment will likely fail anyway, without the break, # it will fail with deploy timeout. Added logging to help # debugging this. while (config_drive_part not in utils.execute('ls', config_drive_part, check_exit_code=[0, 2])[0]): LOG.debug('Still waiting for a device %s to appear in /dev.', config_drive_part) time.sleep(IS_PARTITION_CREATED_CHECK_INTERVAL)

"}, {'number': 23, 'created': '2016-09-15 16:56:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/ebfc51618856eaadd7e274c50477d47e0f6947a4', 'message': "[Reports] WIP! New command `rally verrify trends'

This allows to get trends report for given verifications.
Option `--detailed' includes tracebacks and other messages.

Examples:
  rally verify trends --uuids <uuid1> <uuid2> --detailed > trends.html
  rally verify trends --uuids <uuid1> <uuid2> --out trends.html

Co-Authored-By: Oleksandr Savatieiev <osavatieiev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Maretskiy <amaretskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I942e0d9bf2094f3254dbeccbaa76dbbc3a3ca40e
"}, {'number': 24, 'created': '2016-09-16 13:03:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/9b53320b84dffc996f4820e96c3b5b72d7b3167c', 'message': "[Reports] WIP! New command `rally verrify trends'

This allows to get trends report for given verifications.
Option `--detailed' includes tracebacks and other messages.

Examples:

  rally verify trends --uuids <uuid1> <uuid2> --out trends.html

"}, {'number': 25, 'created': '2016-09-19 15:10:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/3df5a90bd5f47f7a975817dad1f999d5d82deb44', 'message': "[Reports] Improve verification report

Significant improvements:

 * ability to show several verifications results (this
   deprecates `rally verify compare')
 * new, unified, AngularJS/Jinja2-based template
 * new verifications results processing
 * new module rally.ui.report which cares about
   report generation (this is a place where code from
   rally.task.processing.plot should be also moved to)

Now command `rally verify results' can take more than one UUID.
For example:

  rally verify results\
     --uuid <uuid> --html > single_run.html

  rally verify results\
    --uuid <uuid1> <uuid2> --html > compare_2.html

  rally verify results\
    --uuid <uuid1> <uuid2> <uuid3> --html > compare_3.html

  And so on...

Co-Authored-By: Oleksandr Savatieiev <osavatieiev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Maretskiy <amaretskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I942e0d9bf2094f3254dbeccbaa76dbbc3a3ca40e

 * new verifications results processing
 * new module rally.ui.report which cares about

Examples:

  rally verify results\
    --uuid <uuid> --html > single_verification_result.html

  rally verify results\
    --uuid <uuid1> <uuid2> <uuid3> --html > compare_3.html

commit_message:
[Reports] Significant improvements in verification report

 * ability to show several verifications results (this
   deprecates command `rally verify compare')
 * command `rally verify compare' is removed - new report
   compares results in better way
 * new, unified, AngularJS/Jinja2-based template
 * new verifications results processing
 * new module rally.ui.report which cares about
   report generation (this is a place where code from
   rally.task.processing.plot should be also moved)

Examples:

  rally verify results\
    --uuid <uuid> --html > single_verification_result.html

  rally verify results\
    --uuid <uuid1> <uuid2> <uuid3> --html > compare_3.html

Co-Authored-By: Oleksandr Savatieiev <osavatieiev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Maretskiy <amaretskiy@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I942e0d9bf2094f3254dbeccbaa76dbbc3a3ca40e

commit_message:
Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: I458791aa8027cffeeec49698b302cb96ae5af2e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/26/384626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - Parameters that control the number of spawned child processes for distributing processing have had their default value changed from ::processorcount to ::os_workers.

commit_message:
[Tests] Fix functional test_time_hook

Hook results order can differ depending on which hook has
finished first, so functional test can fail sometimes.
This is fixed by sorting results.

Change-Id: Ie6dc1d85e6107dddaa464019b53465c287d0f345

commit_message:
[sentinels] Fix hosts extracting and slaves usage

1) Provide master_group_name as virtual_host in url:
   zmq+sentinel://:password@sentinel-a,:password@sentinel-b/master_group_name
2) Use slaves for the read operations like SMEMBERS.

Change-Id: I690ecae4a260feef5425eac1f3f5b0e5cf4bb2d7

commit_message:
set_db_attribute differs between vsctl and native

On the following:

b.set_db_attribute('Port', pname, 'other_config', {'a': 'b'})
b.set_db_attribute('Port', pname, 'other_config', {'c': 'd'})

will produce different results between the vsctl and native OVSDB
implementations. vsctl will merge the values into a single dict
and native will overwrite the dict.

This patch makes the native implementation mirror vsctl.

Related-Bug: #1630920
Change-Id: Ie7680a301b8b3ee8e5654666e2aea78ecbd07a12

commit_message:
Allow operators to change hw_disk_discard in Nova

Some base image distros don't ship new enough versions of libvirt/qemu
to support hw_disk_discard in Nova (libvirt (1, 0, 6) or later and qemu
(1, 6, 0) or later).

When deploying Nova with Ceph enabled this config item is automatically
turned on, we should give operators a chance to disable it.

Change-Id: I0b2615c64a9569c09567bf456815f93254d90ade
Closes-Bug: #1632348
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/35/385035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Discard option for nova managed disks. Requires libvirt (1, 0, 6) or later and # qemu (1, 6, 0) or later. Set to "" to disable. nova_hw_disk_discard: "unmap"

commit_message:
Add workaround for vertica filtering issue

Vertica measurement and statistics queries seem to be using
the wrong projection for measurements, this adds a hint
to use the correct one.

Change-Id: I60adaf37f6ee17060077400bfee7ce356c40245f

commit_message:
Fix api_extensions_path in neutron-opencontrail environment

There is a missing repositiry for LBaaS in api_extensions_path in neutron-opencontrail.
This patch is working in my lab : tripleo liberty and opencontrail 3.0.2

Closes-Bug: #1634120

Change-Id: Ie06612faf226d0e5e75f3f8a9b560118cba5ff4c
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2cd90e8f36ce07d40763fb3b92292194f9d9c173)

commit_message:
Refactor get_object in object/db/api

Given that OVO work is under progress and is kind of blocked
by missing support for sqlalchemy queries like first() or one() etc
via helper method. This patch will refactor get_object in order to
support one(), one_or_none() queries by passing method name as argument
to get object. There are many cases where this refactor would be helpful
[3], [4]. For example existing api is unable to handle use cases
like [1], [2].

[1].https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/extensions/dns_integration.py#L65
[2].https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/extensions/dns_integration.py#L102-L103

This patch is needed OVO patches under progress which I linked below.
[3]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/334695/
[4]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/338625/

Change-Id: I65657ada39fe87c839a66cc776acca0b14ac2f35

commit_message:
Use target VIF information on live migration

Nova should be able retrieve the vif information for the migration
target already in pre_live_migration. This allows checking
if the portbinding failed and to abort the migration.

Nova should be able to modify the network defintion of an
instance to match the networking on the target node. This must happen
before live migration is being executed.

blueprint migration-use-target-vif

Change-Id: I949778edf06b8db5381a26eb94efabe99adbf347
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/90/301090/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Use target VIF information on live migration ============================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/migration-use-target-vif Today, instances are migrated to the migration target without doing any modifications to the networks vif information. The instance gets migrated with the information from the migration source host. This blueprint introduces some code, that allows to migration of a vm with a modified network definition. This blueprint is written with focus on the nova libvirt virt driver. However the problem is applicable for all nova virt drivers. Problem description =================== Today, instances are migrated to the migration target without doing any modifications to the networks vif information. The instance gets migrated with the information from the migration source host. This is relevant in the following scenarios: #. Migration between hosts that run different l2 agents Today Live Migration is only working between nodes that run the same Neutron l2 agent. If compute nodes run different l2 agents, for example the source node runs linuxbridge and the target node runs ovs, migration runs into problems. * linuxbridge to ovs: * Migration succeeds * Instance in state ACTIVE * Port in state DOWN * Impact: Instance is not connected to the l2 network anymore * Reason: Nova did plug the port as linuxbridge port, although the target requires an ovs port. Due to that, the neutron ovs l2 agent will not detect that vif and though will not report it as up. * ovs-normal to linuxbridge * Migration fails, instance still on source host * Instance in state ACTIVE * Port in state ACTIVE * Impact: Live Migration not working * Reason: Migration xml contains br-int as interface source, but br-int is not available on the migration target. Libvirt fails with "libvirtError: Cannot get interface MTU on 'br-int': No such device" * ovs-hybrid to linuxbridge * Migration succeeds * Instance in state ACTIVE * Port in state ACTIVE * Impact: Instance is not connected to the l2 network anymore * Reason: Nova did plug the port as ovs hybrid port, although the target requires an linuxbridge port. The linuxbridge l2 agent detected that new port along the tap device that appeared and reported it as up. But it did not check if the tap has been plugged into the right bridge, which is probably a Neutron bug. But if that bug would have been solved, the port would be in DOWN state, but still the instance got migrated. This is not a full list of possible l2 agent combinations for migration. In all scenarios where ovs-hybrid plug is enabled in multi l2 agent clouds you have to consider this Neutron bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1560957 #. Migration with Neutron MacVTap agent in some special configuration The Neutron MacVTap agent needs a physical_interface_mapping configuration set up. On a high level, it specifies which NICs should be used for a certain network. On instance boot, Neutron returns this information as part of the create port response. The libvirt MacVTap vif driver then uses this interface in the instances domain.xml as source for the macvtap. Migration works fine as long as the deployer used the same physical_interface_mapping parameter on each node. However if the interface mapping is not equal it gets problematic. This issue is tracked with Neutron bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1550400 * Physical interface not present on target host (using vlan) * mapping source: ``physnet1:eth0``, mapping target: ``physnet1:eth1`` * Migration fails, instance still on source host * Instance in state ACTIVE * port in state ACTIVE * Impact: Migration not working * Reason: In pre_live_migration nova tries to plug the vif. Therefore it tries to create a vlan subinterface on the interface which will fail. Migration fails in pre_live_migration. * Physical interface used on the source is used for another physical network on the migration target * mapping source: ``physnet1:eth0,physnet2:eth3``, mapping target: ``physnet1:eth1,physnet2:eth0`` * Migration succeeds * Instance in state ACTIVE * Port in state ACTIVE * Impact: Instance is not connected to its l2 network anymore but to another one * Reason: The interface name e.g. eth0 is hard coded into the domain.xml .. code-block:: <interface type='direct'> <source dev='eth0' /> </interface> On Live Migration, libvirt will use the same interface definition on the target like on the source, although something else should be used. From code perspective, the problem could be divided into 2 sub problems #. Nova needs to get the vif information that is used on the migration target from Neutron. #. Nova virt drivers need to modify the instance definition on migration. In the libvirt case, the virt driver needs to update the interface section of the domain.xml with vif data used on the migration target. Use Cases --------- #. Migration between hosts that run different l2 agents The proposed enhancement could be used as transition strategy from one l2 agent to the other. Today, an operator would need to rebuild the instance on the target node that runs the new l2 agent. #. Migration with Neutron MacVTap agent where physical_interface_mapping parameters are not equal cross the cloud Proposed change =============== Above we identified 2 sub problems #. Nova needs to get the vif information used on the migration target This information comes from the Neutron server and is stored in the related Neutron Port information. Just querying the Port does not work, as always the vif information from the Ports binding:host_id is returned. To get the vif information that should be used on the migration target, the ports binding:host_id attribute needs to be updated with the destination host. Today this already happens in post_live_migration which is too late. The proposal is to do update the binding:host_id attribute already in pre_live_migration. Then, in live migration operation, the target vif information is available. If migration fails for some reason, the port binding should be set back to the source host again (this is how it is today). #. Nova virt driver needs to update the instance definition with this information Secondly the nova virt driver needs to update the instance definiton with this information. Alternatives ------------ * New Neutron API that returns the target vif information for the passed host without setting the binding:host_id attribute (and though the target vif information)in the database. * Neutron allows a port to be bound to 2 hosts at the same time. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Probably one additional list-ports call to Neutron. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <andreas-scheuring> Other contributors: <None> Work Items ---------- * Do port binding in pre_live_migration * Implement logic in libvirt driver to modify the domain xml Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit tests * Other tests have a dependency on a multinode job running to different l2 agents. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Mitaka - Introduced

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 09:37:39.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/murano/tasks/start.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/b6cf81387d216de8f941bb0a748740a29b86eb23', 'message': 'Murano fails to deploy - cannot check core library

Murano sometimes fails to deploy due to delay in haproxy
identifying started API services. Instead of waiting for all the
services and checking existance of core library via VIP deploy

Change-Id: I2934579edc910e81730dd89dbd8ff9eb11a2cc1c

commit_message:
Murano fails to deploy - cannot check core library

Murano sometimes fails to deploy due to delay in haproxy
identifying started API services. Instead of waiting for all the
services and checking existance of core library via VIP deploy
task should connect to one of the services directly for testing
service status and for package import.

Change-Id: I2934579edc910e81730dd89dbd8ff9eb11a2cc1c
Closes-Bug: #1634531
(cherry picked from commit d7d8fc8069eb15e4b705ccf3d5620faf7c3c28b5)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/25/316725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: networking-calico is the Neutron stadium sub-project that provides 'Calico'Calico networks are primarily intended to be provisioned in advance by the cloud operator, rather than being created by and for a particular tenant. They all share the same address space, and there is automatic east-west reachability between different Calico networks, without any need for Neutron virtual routers. In other words, they are provider networks. Each VM's fixed IP can be Reachability to and from the outside world depends on whether and how the cloud operator provides connectivity between their compute servers and the Internet. In particular: - Each compute server needs a route (often its default route) to the Internet, for IP prefixes outside the data center. - The data center's border gateways need to have BGP speakers that peer with those on each compute server, so that they can route.
deleted_lines: networking-calico is the Neutron 'stadium' sub-project that provides 'Calico'

commit_message:
[doc] Allow creating loadbalancer with network_id

It is now possible to use network_id in create load balancer.
This change adds this option to the 2.0 API docs and the
parameters yaml file.

Change-Id: I2f9bd6a5a986c9f3cbfa38be97d2bda1c9123ccb
Closes-Bug: 1624048
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/80/381280/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - ``vip_network_id``. This can be used in place of ``vip_subnet_id``. When this option is used, the vip port is created on the given network using the default neutron behavior. If neutron assigns multiple fixed ips, an ipv4 addresses is chosen as the vip in preference to ipv6 addresses.

commit_message:
Use correct Kibana version on the gates

We bumped the Kibana version from 4.4 to 4.6 with
Ia18cb89e0951359226add5cbd96d3a91c7fcfd8a. This version should be
used on the gates as well.

Change-Id: I21ccac9a12e4b604d3cf336c6263f2e4cd925524
Closes-bug: #1634049

commit_message:
Consistently set sys path when using local tools

Consistently set the search path to prefer PROJECT_ROOT as the source
of packages to import if we are using local tools instead of pip
installed kolla tools.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Idd1d98bb82a8f1ddb32d1bdb23f346b461534b9f

subject: Avoid update resource if compute node not updated
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 10:17:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/fakes.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f2cd1d34f63e6d4e618a0fece43ec778d00bded7', 'message': "Avoid update resource if compute node not updated

There's a race condition that compute record might be created
and updated through objects.compute_node.update_from_virt_driver
function, but some fields free_disk_gb are not updated yet
so accessing from scheduler service will find a 'None' value
and lead to exception

Change-Id: Ia68298a3f01d89bbf302ac734389f7282176c553
Closes-Bug: 1610679
(cherry picked from commit 36a0ba9c8141b445f2c6bfc093fde4cc98d229b2)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid update resource if compute node not updated

There's a race condition that compute record might be created
and updated through objects.compute_node.update_from_virt_driver
function, but some fields free_disk_gb are not updated yet
so accessing from scheduler service will find a 'None' value
and lead to exception

Change-Id: Ia68298a3f01d89bbf302ac734389f7282176c553
Closes-Bug: 1610679
(cherry picked from commit 36a0ba9c8141b445f2c6bfc093fde4cc98d229b2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/387332/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jichenjc): if the compute record is just created but not updated # some field such as free_disk_gb can be None if compute.updated_at is None: return

revisions:

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-24 16:33:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0efae64f7244354b830c53cdd12b1eb9f1bc668b', 'message': 'Add check when suspend action

there is a chance that instance might not have host field
set, we can add a check before proceed to provide readable
exceptions to upper layer.

There is a possiblity that a unshelved instance might
become ACTIVE before its host set, so in order to catch
those kind of exception and raise better info to API layer
instead of 500.

Change-Id: Ia50ceba3929a2f6d4116978c3b3012f3022fa896
Closes-Bug: 1610487

Closes-Bug: 1610487

commit_message:
Add check when suspend action

there is a chance that instance might not have host field
set, we can add a check before proceed to provide readable
exceptions to upper layer.

Change-Id: Ia50ceba3929a2f6d4116978c3b3012f3022fa896
Closes-Bug: 1610487
Related-Bug: 1611008

commit_message:
Port prechecks only for enabled services

This PS adds logic to control when port prechecks
are made depending if the service is enabled or not.
Using conditionals will reduce prechecks role
execution time.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I81b7359a4d80ac2da169267661f372b9f17e6a8f

commit_message:
Update globals.yml Docker registry example notes

Note that the 'docker_registry_password' can also be set in
passwords.yml since most people may want to use Ansible's vault to
secure their password files.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I8980aaaf7af97c1751012de427d20ba09cda1252

commit_message:
Make iscsi config.yml consistent with start.yml

As part of non-lvm iscsi bugfix, changes were introduced
to iscsi's start.yml. Same changes/conditions should be
reflected to config.yml so container configuration is deployed on
the same nodes as containers are started.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib988df2d36983d63a3aff4226224dc5fc6064221

commit_message:
DNM: Fix device_exists() failures

I keep seeing the device_exists tests fail for all python
versions in some of my upstream changes.  Want to see if
moving the mock up to the class level helps out.  Since I
can't reproduce this locally need the upstream jobs to help test.

Change-Id: I6c4af82f617c0c4de1f4f95984c4f39ed0c6202f

commit_message:
Fix running unknown commands in daemon mode

Running a unknown command (which is mentioned in the filter
but not available on the filesystem) leads currently to an exception.
Make sure that the return codes for both, daemon and non-daemon mode
are equal when running the same command.
Also add functional tests for this case.

Change-Id: I20004c3c370d004b5b76f4c8f8ab167d0949fabf
Closes-Bug: #1632768

subject: Add an option to generate fixed MAC addresses
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 14:57:13.000000000', 'files': ['tests/host_vars/container2.yml', 'tasks/container_create.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/container-static-mac-addresses-9aae098fdc8a57cc.yaml', 'templates/container-interface.ini.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/commit/d319546e4f2ee4712fe15bb2da8f976718ffbd42', 'message': 'Add an option to generate fixed MAC addresses

This change resolves a long standing issue where a container's mac
address regenerates when it was restarted. In most cases when a
container is restarted and it's mac address is rotated and nothing bad
happens; mac learning will resolve itself given enough time in just
about all situations. However services like neutron-agents are long
lived and are highly sensitive to network changes. These types of
services expect consistent hardware addressing and when mac
addresses rotate may become confused.

To limit the possibility of prolonged downtime caused by mac address
rotation on network sensitive containers an option has been created to
allow a container to have a fixed mac address. If this option is enabled
the container will generate fixed addresses for all networks assosiated
with the specific container. The option is `lxc_container_fixed_mac` and
it has a default value of "false".

Change-Id: I591f3fb58150b5bb0a32ffdf338e54de6af11b5f
Backported-From: Ie1a8dc172c45fc2b4cfa724a2bafa67cb481ba73
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add an option to generate fixed MAC addresses

This change resolves a long standing issue where a container's mac
address regenerates when it was restarted. In most cases when a
container is restarted and it's mac address is rotated and nothing bad
happens; mac learning will resolve itself given enough time in just
about all situations. However services like neutron-agents are long
lived and are highly sensitive to network changes. These types of
services expect consistent hardware addressing and when mac
addresses rotate may become confused.

To limit the possibility of prolonged downtime caused by mac address
rotation on network sensitive containers an option has been created to
allow a container to have a fixed mac address. If this option is enabled
the container will generate fixed addresses for all networks assosiated
with the specific container. The option is `lxc_container_fixed_mac` and
it has a default value of "false".

Change-Id: I591f3fb58150b5bb0a32ffdf338e54de6af11b5f
Backported-From: Ie1a8dc172c45fc2b4cfa724a2bafa67cb481ba73
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create refs/changes/11/387511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enable fixed mac address generation for an lxc container lxc_container_fixed_mac: false

commit_message:
Fix api_extensions_path in neutron-opencontrail environment

There is a missing repositiry for LBaaS in api_extensions_path in neutron-opencontrail.
This patch is working in my lab : tripleo liberty and opencontrail 3.0.2

Closes-Bug: #1634120

Change-Id: Ie06612faf226d0e5e75f3f8a9b560118cba5ff4c
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2cd90e8f36ce07d40763fb3b92292194f9d9c173)

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_plugin option in manila

Option "auth_plugin" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated
in Manila.
Use option "auth_type" from group "keystone_authtoken" instead.

Change-Id: Id0cfe82d72cc59a1695c70474344313f5c2f2250
Closes-Bug: #1634724
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/86/388286/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_type = password

subject: Add http as allowed store when glance configured to use rbd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 04:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/70643a5237c11311fdd4381076a067179710e8c0', 'message': 'Add http as allowed store when glance configured to use rbd

Adds http as an allowed store when glance is configured to use
ceph/rbd as the image store. The default configuration for
glance with lvm uses http as a secondary store. http store
is commonly used with automation tools like heat to pull
images into glance from endpoints. Without specifying http
as a store the expected default behavior fails. This patch
restores that default behavior.

Change-Id: Id3663123b8d54e53bd1fd130b65fd8383c9f35c0
Closes-Bug: #1631637
'}]
commit_message:
Add http as allowed store when glance configured to use rbd

Adds http as an allowed store when glance is configured to use
ceph/rbd as the image store. The default configuration for
glance with lvm uses http as a secondary store. http store
is commonly used with automation tools like heat to pull
images into glance from endpoints. Without specifying http
as a store the expected default behavior fails. This patch
restores that default behavior.

Change-Id: Id3663123b8d54e53bd1fd130b65fd8383c9f35c0
Closes-Bug: #1631637
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/82/388382/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stores = rbd,http

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Remove default=None when set value in Config

By default oslo.cfg sets the default values as None [1], There is
no need to explicitly do this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L829

Change-Id: Icbf3a207d05487800133d5c779e57ece8900aa32

commit_message:
[zmq] SUB-PUB local proxy

Central + local proxies combination optimizes following:

* Makes it possible to shorten the number of TCP connections
to a single subscription from node.

* PUB/SUB limitation of 10k consumers can be bumped up to 10k nodes
not only to 10k services

* Fanout happens in 2 steps therefore central proxy takes less load
and blocks for a shorter period of time since it needs to fanout
to less consumers (local proxies) not directly to every single service.

Change-Id: I57d87bc8310354142ab69a9f2d3e0a0cf5b972b8

added_lines: from oslo_messaging._drivers.zmq_driver.proxy \ import zmq_base_proxyclass SingleRouterProxy(zmq_base_proxy.ProxyBase): super(SingleRouterProxy, self).__init__(conf, context, matchmaker) self.fe_router_socket = zmq_base_proxy.create_socket( conf, context, port, zmq.ROUTER) self.be_router_socket = zmq_base_proxy.create_socket( conf, context, port, zmq.ROUTER)
deleted_lines: def check_message_format(func): def _check_message_format(*args, **kwargs): try: return func(*args, **kwargs) except Exception as e: LOG.error(_LE("Received message with wrong format")) LOG.exception(e) return _check_message_format class SingleRouterProxy(object): self.conf = conf self.context = context self.matchmaker = matchmaker LOG.info(_LI("Running %s proxy") % self.PROXY_TYPE) self.poller = zmq_async.get_poller() self.fe_router_socket = self._create_router_socket(conf, context, port) @staticmethod def _create_router_socket(conf, context, port): host = conf.zmq_proxy_opts.host identity = six.b(host) + b"/zmq-proxy/" + six.b(str(uuid.uuid4())) if port != 0: return zmq_socket.ZmqFixedPortSocket(conf, context, zmq.ROUTER, host, port, identity=identity) else: return zmq_socket.ZmqRandomPortSocket(conf, context, zmq.ROUTER, host, identity=identity) @staticmethod @check_message_format def _receive_message(socket): message = socket.recv_multipart() assert len(message) > zmq_names.MESSAGE_ID_IDX, "Not enough parts" assert message[zmq_names.REPLY_ID_IDX] != b'', "Valid id expected" message_type = int(message[zmq_names.MESSAGE_TYPE_IDX]) assert message_type in zmq_names.MESSAGE_TYPES, "Known type expected!" assert message[zmq_names.EMPTY_IDX] == b'', "Empty delimiter expected" return message self.be_router_socket = self._create_router_socket(conf, context, port)

commit_message:
Add ability to set upper constraints file

When this role executes the installation of packages, upper
constraints should be used.

This patch adds the ability to set an upper constraint
file URL/path.

The tox config is also adjusted to ensure that it makes
use of upper constraints when installing requirements.

Change-Id: I3cebfe7d8aec84dc533f208f9bdf0a5eb52d9dcd

commit_message:
Tweak api-ref doc for v3 roles

The current API doc for v3 roles is very difficult to navigate. This
patch reorders the APIs in the following order:

- roles
- group roles on domain
- user roles on domain
- group roles on project
- user roles on project
- implied (infererence) roles
- others

Inside each group, APIs are reordered as following:

- list
- create (assign)
- get/retrieve
- verify/confirm (if applicable)
- update (if applicable)
- delete

Change-Id: I465cd493958a3e8384a7ae750b528d5fc08326de

added_lines: Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role_id: role_id_path List role assignments for group on domain ========================================= .. rest_method:: GET /v3/domains/{domain_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles Relationship: ``http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/domain_group_roles`` Lists role assignments for a group on a domain. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 200 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - domain_id: domain_id_path - group_id: group_id_path Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/admin/domain-group-roles-list-response.json :language: javascript The functionality of this request can also be achieved using the generalized list assignments API:: GET /role_assignments?group.id={group_id}&scope.domain.id={domain_id} Assign role to group on domain ============================== .. rest_method:: PUT /v3/domains/{domain_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles/{role_id} Relationship: ``http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/domain_group_role`` Assigns a role to a group on a domain. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 204 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 - 404 - domain_id: domain_id_path - group_id: group_id_path - role_id: role_id_path Check whether group has role assignment on domain ================================================= .. rest_method:: HEAD /v3/domains/{domain_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles/{role_id} Relationship: ``http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/domain_group_role`` Validates that a group has a role assignment on a domain. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 204 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 - 404 Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - domain_id: domain_id_path - group_id: group_id_path - role_id: role_id_path Unassign role from group on domain ================================== .. rest_method:: DELETE /v3/domains/{domain_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles/{role_id} Relationship: ``http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/domain_group_role`` Unassigns a role from a group on a domain. subject: Tweak api-ref doc for v3 roles status codes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 07:43:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/673ef512bfc3a786b13f1d64f3a1519f54bcac8a', 'message': 'Tweak api-ref doc for v3 roles

The current API doc for v3 roles is very difficult to navigate. This
patch reorders the APIs in the following order and it reformats the
presentation of status codes:

- roles
- group roles on domain
- user roles on domain
- group roles on project
- user roles on project
- implied (infererence) roles
- others

Inside each group, APIs are reordered as following:

- list
- create (assign)
- get/retrieve
- verify (if applicable)
- update (if applicable)
- delete

Change-Id: I706f7dfa16b11aaa9b6233d8b41a11822012e746
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-26 05:00:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/46e78548cca819817638bbc79ad6e61a85b4adad', 'message': 'Tweak api-ref doc for v3 roles status codes

in api-ref documentation.

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-19 12:29:10.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v3/roles.inc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/bc756d5152a1a7c08943a40e9469e78ec0e6acb1', 'message': 'Tweak api-ref doc for v3 roles status codes

'}]
commit_message:
Tweak api-ref doc for v3 roles status codes

This patch reformats the presentation of status codes for the v3 roles
in api-ref documentation.

Change-Id: I706f7dfa16b11aaa9b6233d8b41a11822012e746
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/94/367794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Bump os-client-config to 1.22.0

A number of releases toward the end of Newton caused trouble
for the consuming projects.  The beginning of Ocata is a good time
to bump everyone up to the current happy-fun-goodtime release.

This will also allow OSC and osc-lib to get rid of a bunch of
compatibility-workaround code without harming shade or other
consumers of o-c-c.

Change-Id: I296b6eee97affd6bbacf48e91a5db1b01ddebb4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/39/386739/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
test_routers_flavors: Skip if requirements are not met

- Require l3-flavors extension and enable it on gate
- Skip on ServiceProfileDriverNotFound

Closes-Bug: #1633339
Change-Id: I53ccc6ec33665160b44d699c96795dc72f1710e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/93/386393/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.requires_ext(extension="l3-flavors", service="network") try: sp = cls.admin_client.create_service_profile(driver=driver) except lib_exc.NotFound as e: if e.resp_body['type'] == 'ServiceProfileDriverNotFound': raise cls.skipException("%s is not available" % driver) raise try: sp = cls.admin_client.create_service_profile(driver=driver) except lib_exc.NotFound as e: if e.resp_body['type'] == 'ServiceProfileDriverNotFound': raise cls.skipException("%s is not available" % driver) raise

With this patch we are virtually forbidding any unexpected fields in API

Change-Id: I7cfcabf6e3774c58a30cd89d7d1b88be98aef240
'}]
commit_message:
Stricter object fields checking

With this patch we are virtually forbidding any unexpected fields in API
requests. This might be a good thing following the API-WG discussion
previously.

Change-Id: I7cfcabf6e3774c58a30cd89d7d1b88be98aef240
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/27/388727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'additionalProperties': False,

commit_message:
Fix api_paste_config option

Option "api_paste_config" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated
in Nova.
Use option "api_paste_config" from group "wsgi".

Change-Id: I7727aa67da71fefe20b2aaefb1337dba4f9008b1
Closes-Bug: #1632066
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/10/388610/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [wsgi] api_paste_config = /etc/nova/api-paste.ini

commit_message:
Add an option for deploying OSA or other OSA powered cloud

Add an option $RUN_OSA to the deploy-osa.sh to let user have more
choices, if user want to deploy another OSA powered cloud on AIO-
multinode, he can switch it to false and then use the existing env
to deploy the cloud he wants to.

Change-Id: Ief8c701f596595607d3b86ac03f17d6690f5954f
Closes-Bug: #1634582
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/16/388216/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enable deploy OSA of the "${RUN_OSA}" RUN_OSA=${RUN_OSA:-true} if [[ "${RUN_OSA}" = true ]]; then pushd /opt/openstack-ansible/ # Bootstrap ansible into the environment bash ./scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh # Generate the passwords for the environment python ./scripts/pw-token-gen.py --file /etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml # This is happening so the VMs running the infra use less storage osa_user_var_add lxc_container_backing_store 'lxc_container_backing_store: dir' # Tempest is being configured to use a known network osa_user_var_add tempest_public_subnet_cidr 'tempest_public_subnet_cidr: 172.29.248.0/22' # This makes running neutron in a distributed system easier and a lot less noisy osa_user_var_add neutron_l2_population 'neutron_l2_population: True' # This makes the glance image store use swift instead of the file backend osa_user_var_add glance_default_store 'glance_default_store: swift' popd # Set the number of forks for the ansible client calls export ANSIBLE_FORKS=${ANSIBLE_FORKS:-15} pushd /opt/openstack-ansible export DEPLOY_AIO=true bash ./scripts/run-playbooks.sh popd EXEC_DIR="$(pwd)" pushd /opt/openstack-ansible/playbooks if [[ -f "/usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc" ]]; then source /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc fi ansible -m script -a "${EXEC_DIR}/openstack-service-setup.sh" 'utility_all[0]' popd fi

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 12:37:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install/commit/2206f94efd84a480a1cb491ac04b2e3cfd4006b0', 'message': "Ensure that continuation doesn't add a new line

commit_message:
Ensure that continuation doesn't add a new line

When using a line continuation, newlines are added to the
resulting string. For the pip module's extra_args this
causes some unexpected behaviour, for example:

/usr/local/bin/pip install -U --constraint http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt \n ndg-httpsclient requests

While in this particular case it ends up working, it breaks
in other cases with an error indicating that it could not
find the requirements to install.

As seen in [1] the way to ensure that there is no newline
added we adjust the way the continuation is implemented
just slightly.

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3790454/in-yaml-how-do-i-break-a-string-over-multiple-lines

Change-Id: I3d6c9dd1faeb2bf9c9c422100f54f90c1e3e5bc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/71/388671/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set TRIPLEO_ROOT before it is first used

In I01bf15b3c689b4fd0cdd848cf264dd9794e1d828 a new usage of TRIPLEO_ROOT
was introduced to check for the deploy.env file. This was added above
where the default value is set. This then causes scripts to fail it they
don't allow unbound variables.

Change-Id: Ib61931a72833a0902daef392b4cf9399e75ee3a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/42/388542/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TRIPLEO_ROOT=${TRIPLEO_ROOT:-$HOME/tripleo}

commit_message:
Memcache configuration for Ceilometer is broken

At the moment we use "memcached_servers =
{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ memcached_port }}" in
keystone_authtoken for Ceilometer.
This cannot work because we our haproxy service does
not offer memcache, so fix it.

Change-Id: I7d9630b8b232f0e5e2a0a33304817a1b255d4855
Closes-Bug: #1634146
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/73/388273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: memcached_servers = {% for host in groups['memcached'] %}{{ hostvars[host]['ansible_' + hostvars[host]['api_interface']]['ipv4']['address'] }}:{{ memcached_port }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}

commit_message:
List Ceph Pools

Adding a function in the ceph library to allow listing
of the currently available pools in ceph.

Change-Id: I28d684cc3041ed9f8661fb45f096b70a1095f64f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.ceph refs/changes/58/383958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list_pools(service): """ This will list the current pools that Ceph has :param service: String service id to run under :return: list. Returns a list of the ceph pools. """ try: pool_list = [] pools = subprocess.check_output(['rados', '--id', service, 'lspools']) for pool in pools.splitlines(): pool_list.append(pool) return pool_list except subprocess.CalledProcessError as err: log("rados lspools failed with error: {}".format(err.output)) raise

commit_message:
Fix job_schedule trigger cron

when schedule json_file has some key eg: schedule_{year, week, day}
and so on, it should trigger cron to schedule use apschedule.
But it is unavailable now. This patch should fix it use cron date.

Change-Id: I0113158d60605109fdeefe74f45f4050b5a75d7a
Closes-Bug: #1599715
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/79/338679/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cron_schedule = {} for cron in [i for i in self.job_doc['job_schedule'].keys() if i.startswith('schedule_')]: cron_key = cron[9:] cron_schedule.update({cron_key: self.job_doc['job_schedule'][cron] }) for key, value in cron_schedule.items() kwargs = {'trigger': 'cron'} kwargs.update(cron_fields) return kwargs
deleted_lines: for key, value in self.job_doc['job_schedule'].items() return {'trigger': 'cron'}.update(cron_fields)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 04:55:58.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/4379f12876ab0d8f90cb2f1568a43b08cb457e9d', 'message': 'Remove FWaaS dependency in VPNaaS devstack plugin

Right now if the FWaaS configuration file does not exist, a devstack
trying to start VPNaaS may fail[1].  This is unnecessary; since FWaaS is
now using the L3 agent extension code, it plugs in that way.  It should
not interfere at all with VPNaaS.  This change removes the FWaaS

Change-Id: I28e48ab161e7991a24fec181e4ec7378888f9149
'}]
commit_message:
Remove FWaaS dependency in VPNaaS devstack plugin

Right now if the FWaaS configuration file does not exist, a devstack
trying to start VPNaaS may fail[1].  This is unnecessary; since FWaaS is
now using the L3 agent extension code, it plugs in that way.  It should
not interfere at all with VPNaaS.  This change removes the FWaaS
dependency in the devstack plugin.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/584360/

Change-Id: I28e48ab161e7991a24fec181e4ec7378888f9149

commit_message:
Make help message more accurate and user-friendly

Now in python-fuelclient if we try to get help message
for specific command with '--help' option, e.g.:

      fuel2 node list --help

the output result looks very ugly, because it prints
all available commands in fuel2 instead of detailed
description for exact command. Also we have similar
behavior if we try to specify non-existing command.
This patch makes help message more accurate and
user-friendly, e.g.:

      #fuel2 env add nodes --help

usage: fuel2 env add nodes [-h] -e ENV -n NODES [NODES ...]
                           -r ROLES [ROLES ...]

Adds nodes to an environment with the specified roles.

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -e ENV, --env ENV     Id of the environment to add nodes to
  -n NODES [NODES ...], --nodes NODES [NODES ...]
                        Ids of the nodes to add.
  -r ROLES [ROLES ...], --roles ROLES [ROLES ...]
                        Target roles of the nodes.

     #fuel2 non-existing --help

Unknown command ['non-existing']

Change-Id: I89afb39d92ffb01c37fbf558e6d62091ac6112e7
Partial-Bug: 1629285

commit_message:
fix job_schedule result and start/end timestamps

The following fields of the job document are now correctly updated
when the freezer_scheduler starts and stops a job.

- time_started
- time_ended
- result

In case of recurring job the "result" field is updated with the
result of the last job's execution.

Change-Id: I35d804b12f65d2123fdcb558b770cf6eef871d1e
Closes-Bug: #1631074

commit_message:
Modify 'updated_at' time on image member changes

Change the `updated_at` time of the image whenever image members are
added, changed, deleted. This functionality was requested by the
SearchLight project to facilitate correct notifications handling.
Please refer to the bug, for detailed discussion.

Closes-Bug: #1547079

Change-Id: Ifd657dddfdef1d76268fd79b3acb5a9f8dca4f51

subject: Add abililty to find floating IP network by subnet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 13:27:57.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/9986646a131cf618476d24be18ab22f0da9de926', 'message': "Add abililty to find floating IP network by subnet

If the cloud has a hidden public network but a visible router, it's not
possible to infer network info from metadata, but it is possible to know
that the network that the floating IP should be requested on is the one
that is in the router's external_gateway_info field.

Wrap the search in local caching and a lock to prevernt thundering herd.
It's not a thing that will need to be inferred more than once, but has
the potential to be hit on every server creation for clouds that need
this.

Change-Id: Ic98b6059e0ca5d0f1c8e6db16cc89a352c6fbbbd
"}]
commit_message:
Add abililty to find floating IP network by subnet

If the cloud has a hidden public network but a visible router, it's not
possible to infer network info from metadata, but it is possible to know
that the network that the floating IP should be requested on is the one
that is in the router's external_gateway_info field.

Wrap the search in local caching and a lock to prevernt thundering herd.
It's not a thing that will need to be inferred more than once, but has
the potential to be hit on every server creation for clouds that need
this.

Change-Id: Ic98b6059e0ca5d0f1c8e6db16cc89a352c6fbbbd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/05/388705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._floating_network_by_subnet = None self._floating_network_by_subnet_run = False self._floating_network_by_subnet_lock = threading.Lock() def _find_floating_network_by_subnet(self): """Find the network providing floating ips by looking at routers.""" if self._floating_network_by_subnet_lock.acquire( not self._floating_network_by_subnet_run): if self._floating_network_by_subnet_run: self._floating_network_by_subnet_lock.release() return self._floating_network_by_subnet try: for router in self.list_routers(): if router['admin_state_up']: network_id = router.get( 'external_gateway_info', {}).get('network_id') if network: self._floating_network_by_subnet = network_id finally: self._floating_network_by_subnet_run = True self._floating_network_by_subnet_lock.release() return self._floating_network_by_subnet if networks: network_id = networks[0]['id'] else: network_id = self._find_floating_network_by_router() if not network_id: raise OpenStackCloudResourceNotFound( "Unable to find an external network in this cloud" " which makes getting a floating IP impossible")
deleted_lines: if not networks: raise OpenStackCloudResourceNotFound( "Unable to find an external network in this cloud" " which makes getting a floating IP impossible")

Added barbican to be tested on ubuntu

The barbican module has been updated to work on ubuntu. This change
will make it so barbican tests will occur on both centos and ubuntu.

commit_message:
Unblocking the gate

Skipped test_deploy_app_with_volume_creation_from_backup test

Tempest integration test is failing for volume creation from backup
(reported as bug #1634876). To unblock the gate the appropriate test
is skipped for now while the bug is being investigated.

AgentListener unit test didn't properly override configuration, so in
some circumstances it could be executed with the disabled murano agent
which was leading to errors.

At the same time AgentListener itself contained some legacy code
leading to under-initialized state in case if the listener was
disabled in config file.

Related-bug: #1634876
Change-Id: I5642b8017c61f77afb68463ba8eb3906eeae7225
Closes-bug: #1634483

commit_message:
Reset allocation pools to [] instead of ''

the sdk expects subnet allocation pools to be reset to an empty array,
not an empty string.

Currently this results in an error message:

  "Invalid input for allocation_pools. Reason: Invalid data format
   for IP pool"

Change-Id: I7cc84b9c8e4abdbd2c91e5d591ad31f0849c1a83
Closes-Bug: #1634672

added_lines: attrs['allocation_pools'] = []

commit_message:
Fix problem about location header in Zaqar resource2

The name string of location header of Zaqar API response is
lower case. This is inconsistent with the guide from API-WG
and thus make sdk unable to parse location header correctly.
This patch provides a workaround for this issue.

Change-Id: I77a474b17aed55b215eb93a3666d444728ded1e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/08/388308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(anyone): The name string of `location` field of Zaqar API response # is lower case. That is inconsistent with the guide from API-WG. This is # a workaround for this issue. location = resource2.Header("location")

commit_message:
fix logging in fuelmenu

If logging.basicConfig is called after logging.getLogger
then it will not work properly. So we have to call
basicConfig before imports.

Change-Id: I88779187c4bed0f3950d988364ed2f49edc4c9f2
Closes-Bug: #1596646
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-menu refs/changes/47/365747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from fuelmenu import consts import logging # set up logging before other modules will try to get their loggers logging.basicConfig(filename=consts.LOGFILE, format="%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s", level=logging.DEBUG)
deleted_lines: from fuelmenu import constsimport logging# set up logging logging.basicConfig(filename=consts.LOGFILE, format="%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s", level=logging.DEBUG)

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I52d16512abd10d4cb980359bcaba1ed6d683c45a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/23/388123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import openstackdocsthemeimport os 'oslosphinx', 'sphinxmark'html_theme = 'openstackdocs'html_theme_path = [openstackdocstheme.get_html_theme_path()] watermark = os.popen("git branch --contains $(git rev-parse HEAD)\ | awk -F/ '/stable/ {print $2}'").read().strip(' \n\t').capitalize() if watermark == "": watermark = "Pre-release" # -- Options for sphinxmark ----------------------------------------------- sphinxmark_enable = True sphinxmark_div = 'docs-body' sphinxmark_image = 'text' sphinxmark_text = watermark sphinxmark_text_color = (128, 128, 128) sphinxmark_text_size = 70

commit_message:
Install missing json files

  [ Corey Bryant ]
  * d/rules, d/mistral-common.postinst.in, d/mistral-common.postrm:
    Install missing json files (LP: #1634475).
  * d/control: Add python-pep8 to Build-Depends.

  [ Thomas Goirand ]
  * Fixed lsb-base depends.

Change-Id: I145da6344b1b41368deb7e02f92d2a04e71c35df

commit_message:
Upgrade job dont need the overcloud workers settings

Upgrade jobs doesn't need to force the settings for
workers on the overcloud.
In some cases, this cause the failure of the upgrade
when puppet and tht mismatch with this custom config

Change-Id: If049ffaa33a10679d05b6e395ac5b050a33ca8b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/11/388211/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --extra-vars set_overcloud_workers=false \

commit_message:
[ops-guide] Use 'openstack image list' to replace 'nova image-list'

The command 'nova image-list' is deprecated and will be removed after
Nova 15.0.0 is released, so this patch use 'openstack image list' to
replace it in operations guide for cleanup.

Change-Id: I67041464bfe93d670cc4bdd5e8d1d51121e705cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/74/388574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ IMAGE_ID=`openstack image list | egrep cirros | egrep -v "kernel|ramdisk" | awk '{print $2}'`
deleted_lines: $ IMAGE_ID=`nova image-list | egrep cirros | egrep -v "kernel|ramdisk" | awk '{print $2}'`

Add Documentation for Nimble Fibre Channel Driver

Include the Fibre Channel Driver configuration in the config-reference
Closes-Bug: 1633568

added_lines: Support for iSCSI storage protocol is available wih NimbleISCSIDriver Volume Driver class and Fibre Channel with NimbleFCDriver Support for the Liberty release and above is available from Nimble OS 2.3.8 or later. use_multipath_for_image_xfer = True volume_driver = NIMBLE_VOLUME_DRIVER use_multipath_for_image_xfer = True volume_driver = NIMBLE_VOLUME_DRIVERNIMBLE_VOLUME_DRIVER Use either cinder.volume.drivers.nimble.NimbleISCSIDriver for iSCSI or cinder.volume.drivers.nimble.NimbleFCDriver for Fibre Channel
deleted_lines: Support for the Liberty release is available from Nimble OS 2.3.8 or later... note:: The Nimble Storage implementation uses iSCSI only. Fibre Channel is not supported. volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.nimble.NimbleISCSIDriver volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.nimble.NimbleISCSIDriver

commit_message:
API support to cluster-add-nodes2

This patch enables the API layer to send versioned object as parameters
when serving cluster-add-nodes requests.

Change-Id: Ie06adb9792347142af460cc5205a34d01aa57d20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/67/388667/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_cluster_action_add_nodes2(self, mock_enforce): cfg.CONF.set_override('rpc_use_object', True, enforce_type=True) self._mock_enforce_setup(mock_enforce, 'action', True) cid = 'FAKE_ID' body = {'add_nodes': {'nodes': ['NODE1']}} eng_resp = {'action': 'action-id'} req = self._post('/clusters/%(cluster_id)s/action' % { 'cluster_id': cid}, jsonutils.dumps(body)) mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2', return_value=eng_resp) resp = self.controller.action(req, cluster_id=cid, body=body) mock_call.assert_called_once_with(req.context, 'cluster_add_nodes2', mock.ANY) request = mock_call.call_args[0][2] self.assertIsInstance(request, vorc.ClusterAddNodesRequest) self.assertEqual('FAKE_ID', request.identity) self.assertEqual(['NODE1'], request.nodes) result = { 'action': 'action-id', 'location': '/actions/action-id', } self.assertEqual(result, resp) def test_cluster_action_add_nodes2_none(self, 'somevalue'}} req = self._put('/clusters/%(cluster_id)s/action' % { 'cluster_id': cid}, jsonutils.dumps(body)) mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2') ex = self.assertRaises(exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.action, req, cluster_id=cid, body=body) self.assertEqual("Value for 'nodes' must have at least 1 item(s).", six.text_type(ex)) self.assertFalse(mock_call.called) def test_cluster_action_add_nodes2_empty(self, mock_enforce): cfg.CONF.set_override('rpc_use_object', True, enforce_type=True) self._mock_enforce_setup(mock_enforce, self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call') ex = self.assertRaises(exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.action, req, cluster_id=cid, body=body) self.assertEqual("Value for 'nodes' must have at least 1 item(s).", six.text_type(ex)) self.assertFalse(mock_call.called) def test_cluster_action_add_nodes2_bad_requests(self, mock_enforce): cfg.CONF.set_override('rpc_use_object', True, enforce_type=True) self._mock_enforce_setup(mock_enforce, 'action', True) cid = 'aaaa-bbbb-cccc' body = {'add_nodes': {'nodes': ['bad-node-1']}} req = self._post('/clusters/%(cluster_id)s/action' % { Engine support for cluster-add-nodes2

This adds a cluster-add-nodes2 call to the service engine.

Change-Id: I78cca5c0581360448b2c7bb4c9eb94c71d0a1075

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I5680e3e9a49b038a897735c2fe04cd3890b29a0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/51/388151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import openstackdocsthemeimport os 'oslosphinx', 'sphinxmark'html_theme = 'openstackdocs'html_theme_path = [openstackdocstheme.get_html_theme_path()] watermark = os.popen("git branch --contains $(git rev-parse HEAD)\ | awk -F/ '/stable/ {print $2}'").read().strip(' \n\t').capitalize() if watermark == "": watermark = "Pre-release" # -- Options for sphinxmark ----------------------------------------------- sphinxmark_enable = True sphinxmark_div = 'docs-body' sphinxmark_image = 'text' sphinxmark_text = watermark sphinxmark_text_color = (128, 128, 128) sphinxmark_text_size = 70

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I213fbfa4857091111f548168f0d4d2b16f682f67

added_lines: import openstackdocsthemeimport os 'oslosphinx', 'sphinxmark'html_theme = 'openstackdocs'html_theme_path = [openstackdocstheme.get_html_theme_path()] watermark = os.popen("git branch --contains $(git rev-parse HEAD)\ | awk -F/ '/stable/ {print $2}'").read().strip(' \n\t').capitalize() if watermark == "": watermark = "Pre-release" # -- Options for sphinxmark ----------------------------------------------- sphinxmark_enable = True sphinxmark_div = 'docs-body' sphinxmark_image = 'text' sphinxmark_text = watermark sphinxmark_text_color = (128, 128, 128) sphinxmark_text_size = 70

commit_message:
Configure run-validation to use the custom output

The validations now have a custom Ansible formatter that shows a better
report on the validation run, what failed and why, etc. This makes it
available to our Mistral workflows.

Change-Id: Iebe26e3e2922dafc7f93837c4315cebf14563f6d
Depends-On: I9730f2dd04868c5de46ae90bd545865d17aec530
Closes-Bug: #1625526
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/48/379348/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use the custom validation-specific formatter export ANSIBLE_STDOUT_CALLBACK=validation_output

commit_message:
glance_multiple_locations when NovaEnableRbdBackend=true

glance_multiple_locations does not needed when the
NovaEnableRbdBackend=false, but it is neede when both the
image and the instance storage is rbd and
the show_image_direct_url is enabled.

The condition introduced in Ia7e0558e4f318640981abb44d188e3479b5eae69

Change-Id: Ia8a8cd9aeda69e9a7db6f95dcf418f56e29cae00
Closes-Bug: 1632285
(cherry picked from commit 0ff21f83f34212127252773a77e843c6344152db)

commit_message:
Add port to rabbitmq node ip list

We use the rabbit_hosts configuration for most of our services but we
haven't been adding the configured port. This patch appends the IP port
used provided to the service's heat template to the IPs in the list.

Note: while we could use the value set for the rabbitmq server in
rabbitmq::port, it doesn't allow for dealing with SSL. This also is also
backwards compatible with the RabbitClientPort parameters used in the
heat templates.

Change-Id: I0000f039144a6b0e98c0a148dc69324f60db3d8b
Closes-Bug: #1633580
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/61/386761/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # [*rabbit_port*] # IP port for rabbitmq service # Defaults to hiera('cinder::rabbit_port') $rabbit_port = hiera('cinder::rabbit_port', undef), if $rabbit_port { $port_suffix = ":${rabbit_port}" } else { $port_suffix = '' } class { '::cinder' : rabbit_hosts => suffix($rabbit_hosts, $port_suffix)

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I1a91e65fa13412efc8863b2dff13150aec07e1f1

commit_message:
Add IdentityList field type

The added 'IdentityList' field type will be used for parsing and
validating a list of entities. It is an enhanced verion of the 'List'
type from oslo.versionedobjects in that it validates whether a list has
the required minimum items, and whether the list contains duplicated
identities. The limitation is that we only accept strings for this field
type, but that should be okay for our use cases.

Change-Id: I226728dc1a30de40db836c9e40088c2f69841adb

added_lines: class TestIdentityList(TestField): def setUp(self): super(TestIdentityList, self).setUp() self.field = senlin_fields.IdentityList(fields.String()) self.coerce_good_values = [ (['abc'], ['abc']) ] self.coerce_bad_values = [ 123 ] self.to_primitive_values = self.coerce_good_values[0:1] self.from_primitive_values = self.coerce_good_values[0:1] def test_stringify(self): self.assertEqual("['abc','def']", self.field.stringify(['abc', 'def'])) def test_init_with_params(self): sot = senlin_fields.IdentityList(fields.String(), min_items=1, unique=False) self.assertEqual(1, sot.min_items) self.assertFalse(sot.unique_items) def test_coerce_not_unique_okay(self): sot = senlin_fields.IdentityList(fields.String(), min_items=1, unique=False) obj = mock.Mock() # not unique is okay res = sot.coerce(obj, 'attr', ['abc', 'abc']) self.assertEqual(['abc', 'abc'], res) def test_coerce_too_short(self): sot = senlin_fields.IdentityList(fields.String(), min_items=2, unique=False) obj = mock.Mock() # violating min_items ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, sot.coerce, obj, 'attr', []) self.assertEqual("Value for 'attr' must have at least 2 item(s).", six.text_type(ex)) def test_coerce_not_unique_bad(self): obj = mock.Mock() # violating min_items ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.field.coerce, obj, 'attr', ['abc', 'abc']) self.assertEqual("Items for 'attr' must be unique", six.text_type(ex)) def test_get_schema(self): self.assertEqual( { 'type': ['array'], 'items': { 'readonly': False, 'type': ['string'], }, 'minItems': 0, 'uniqueItems': True }, self.field.get_schema() ) sot = senlin_fields.IdentityList(fields.String(), min_items=2, unique=False, nullable=True) self.assertEqual( { 'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': { 'readonly': False, 'type': ['string'], }, 'minItems': 2, 'uniqueItems': False }, sot.get_schema() )

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Ie333cafd923b9dbcbcdd687d510a5aa8698648f0

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Iabd306e4598b100facdd34fa715439df72251d03

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Ie451486cfea257691c2112f1900c78188ce549db

commit_message:
Release Kolla Newton rc3.

We think this is final and expect no more changes to stable/newton prior
to OpenStack Summit, atleast not that would impact the release team.

We will still tag 3.0.0 from this git tag when the deadline Doug had
originally stated hits.

Change-Id: I9cb3764c1b2bcabe1868e00b5481592753f1d806

commit_message:
[user-guide] Use 'openstack image list' to replace 'nova image-list'

The command 'nova image-list' is deprecated and will be removed after
Nova 15.0.0 is released, so this patch use 'openstack image list' to
replace it in user guide for cleanup.

Change-Id: I121ad944e10538ab41c736c50337141893681129

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Idff273dc3bc5f874ee695825c4c97cce0541e9bb
